Reviews.Title: “Adequate water pressure will make it an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: Compared to the nearby Ibis the HY has larger rooms and you donâ€™t feel like you are cramped in a capsule. Unfortunately during my stay water pressure was low and temperature variable in the shower. Not being able to enjoy a decent shower after a long flight is certainly a major problem in an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Gilby_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Holiday Inn for one night, and sadly the service provided was pretty average in a few areas. Now i'm not a very frequent traveller (just one who is Gold with IHG Priority Club), but the whole experience was pretty sub-par. Check-in was pretty quick, but the enthuasium of the staff member was that of being in-different and spoke just the minimal required (ie Credit Card and room details and that's basically it). Rooms are okay, clean as you'd expect and a big enough window to not make it feel like you are trapped inside a prison. Bit dissapointed in the room service, took about 30min to make my burger and chips, although not too fussed about that! A few things that really gets to me are; 1. Rubbish TV, if you have a widescreen TV, display the TV shows in widescreen, and make the reception quality better (and it can be done as you are getting FOXTEL digital!!!) 2. Stand out from other hotels in Australia and offer free internet, To pay $29.95 for 1000mb/24hrs is a complete joke (especially for PC Gold members) 3. Although not directly your issue, this silly $6 charged imposed by the shuttle and SACL, this is a joke! Good things: Close to Mascot station, sort of cheapish, clean and roomy. Bad things: Attitude, loylaty, no free internet, and incorrect room charges.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the night”
Reviews.Author: Bron L
Reviews.Content: Good spot to stay overnight. Tip: If driving, check before arriving that a long term car park space has been left for you. Only a couple of blocks from airport. 10min walk to Pizzeria, shops at Mascot. No road noise, good view.

Reviews.Title: “Your average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night, between flights. Hotel has a shuttle service to domestic and international terminals, but it is free only one way. You have to pay for the return leg. Buffet breakfast is available. Area surrounding hotel is light industrial. There are not restuarants or cafes within walking distance so guests do not have much choice but to eat in the hotel. Gym is small and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jayzee780
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for airport access and trains for travel to other parts of the city. The staff was very helpful with any questions asked and service provided. The hotel itself is a standard Holiday Inn. I felt the room rates were on the high side. What did annoyed me was that the hotel charges a service fee for the use of a credit card. This is the first time I have ever run into this type of charge for a major establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough but what's with the extra charges?”
Reviews.Author: motomoda
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was fine, my room was clean and generally in good condition apart from two dodgy power switches. The front office and function staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. The meal at the bar was OK, not the best pizza I've eaten, but not the worst either. What is annoying is the 'complimentary' shuttle costing $6 each way. Complimentary usually means free in my experience. Perhaps worse though is the feeble Internet service for which you are charged $27.50!!!! This is unjustifiable gouging, even if it worked adequately, which it did not. IC Hotels need to get both a better service and make it free, like most hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulACTAustralia
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Holiday Inn as they had a deal which included carparking for a week. The room was well appointed although maybe needing some refurbishment - bed comfortable and airconditioning most adequate. Bathroom well appointed. We tried to have dinner in the restaurant but service was so slow we transferred to the bar where we enjoyed a "counter meal" and did not regret our decision to abandon the restaurant. Transport to the airport was fine as was the return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TazzyPerth
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here I swore that I would never stay here again, but a year later I decided to give it another go. I should have remained with my original decision. This hotel is looking very tired with old wood lacquer furniture and unmotivated staff. It just feels like an upgraded motel room. The food is average at best, and the worst thing of all is the price they want to charge you for this service. There are other options at Sydney Airport and I recommend you take them.

Reviews.Title: “Some Hits, Some Continued Misses”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMc
Reviews.Content: First stayed in this hotel in 2008, and gave poor review. Contact from IC corporate suggested that the hotel was now upgraded, and being better managed. However the three problems I highlighted in 2008 remain. 1. Shuttle was a disaster previously. Their answer? OUTSOURCING. The outsourced company had rude drivers with poor English skills, and the outsourcing means the shuttle goes to several hotels, the HI not being first. Also the so-called "complimentary" shuttle is now $6 each way, for essentially a five-block run. A run you can't really make by walking unless luggage free. 2. Internet is still almost $30 a day, and still gets slowed to a crawl after only 20% of the paid-for data is used. (What other country in the world charges for data???) This is a continued ripoff of epic proportions. Cost of a monthly internet connection in Australia is roughly the same as this daily charge. 3. Televisions now replaced with cheap flat panels, but the two I saw were never set up properly, are displaying 16:9 HD pictures incorrectly so that you can't read the superimposed text or closed captions, and the signal is so bad it's a complete waste of everyone's time and money. It's Australia. Bloody typical.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating For The Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Dexx
Reviews.Content: We arrived just after 10 in the morning and although all we wanted to do was leave our bags until we could check-in later in the afternoon, we were offered a room straight away. Have just completed an overnight flight this was a very welcome offer. The staff were excellent and the accommodation very comfortable. The hotel is just far enough away from the airport not to be disturbed by aircraft noise. The shuttle from stand 32 at the airport is quick and frequent costing just $6 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Totally average”
Reviews.Author: whereswally2010
Reviews.Content: Quite acceptable airport hotel. Advertised airport courtesy service is outsourced, as things are these days, so a very impersonal service where ou have to walk to an unknown location and wait, and wait and wait. Rooms look quite tired, but are clean. Fancy named pillows are a fancy advertising gimmick and are quite poor quality. Charged for the complimentary airport pickup, but when queried happily removed the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Nottingham
Reviews.Content: Great location for the airport. Rooms are clean, efficient and typical HI standard. Restaurant is good and necessary as nothing is really close if you don't have a car and have to walk. Rooms are suprisingly quiet considering you are so close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good for early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: chrisalberta
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for the airport--few minutes on the shuttle. Very friendly staff and large room with very comfortable bed. Just a few minutes walk from Mascot station which gets you into CBD and Darling Harbour in 15min for a fraction of the cost for the same train from the airport. Just don't know why these big chain hotels charge so much and then nickel and dime you for the short shuttle and WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stop when overnighting between flights”
Reviews.Author: trekker065
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times on short stops between flights. The rooms are comfortable and location from all terminals is a short shuttle ride, however if there is more than two people just catch a cab as we had to wait 30 minutes for the bus. The Biggles bar is a good place for a drink and counter meal but there is also a small number of restaurants an 8 minute walk away at Mascot train station. We will definitely continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable overnight stay when traveling through Sydney airport”
Reviews.Author: Mari_Star_Kitty
Reviews.Content: About a 15 min walk from the domestic terminal or catch the shuttle for a few dollars each way. A taxi will cost $10-12, which is more economical if there are more than two people traveling together. Nice Sirroco restaurant and good quality bar/counter meals in the biggles bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good post-cruise hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Willsot
Reviews.Content: Got off the cruise ship at Circular Quay and took a taxi to the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport as we wanted to be situated near the airport for our flight the next morning. We were pleased to learn our room was available even though it was only 10:00 a.m. The desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very modern and clean. After settling in, we walked up the block to Mascot station and took the train back to Circular Quay. $4.50 each round trip was the best bargain we experienced in Sydney. Spent the day downtown and in the Botanic Gardens then took the easy train ride back to the hotel. The next morning we enjoyed the beautiful breakfast buffet and took the shuttle to the international airport for only $6.00 each. Would have no reservations about staying again the next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but room service a let down”
Reviews.Author: BigGBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at a hotel near Sydney Airport as company I work for are based in Botany. Clean and professional appearance with seamless check in at front desk. Room small but functional and comfortable for my needs. Quiet room. Bar area not bad, staff there a little casual in their service but the finger food was good. B'fast next morning was in the restaurant and was usual buffet style with standard fare - nothing exciting. The one complaint I had was the fact I ordered room service so I could continue to work - seemed to be a bit of a problem for them and I was told there would be a 30-40min wait. 1hr 20mins later it arrived and it was a disappointment as it looked like it had been sitting for a while and the beer was 'sweating' as it had been out of the fridge too long :( Efficient check out however the morning paper I asked for when checking in was not delivered.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and good”
Reviews.Author: MartinCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight when taking family to the international airport. Finding the hotel and parking was straight forward and check in was easy. All of the staff were very friendly. The room I was in was bright, quiet and quite large. The bathroom was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. We relaxed before I drove across to the terminal. The hotel is quite convenient from that perspective, and it is also quite close to Mascot railway station...which I walked to after breakfast and caught a train into the city. Speaking of breakfast, it was a good buffet in a nice space. I had a light dinner in Biggles Bar. The food was good and came quickly. All in all it was an enjoyable stay and I may stay again even if not going to or coming from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but damp”
Reviews.Author: DragonLady13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Sydney Airport domestic terminal and just a couple of blocks from a train station (Mascot), which will get you into central Sydney in 15 minutes for considerably less than taking the train from the airport. Unlike most US airport hotels, there is no free airport shuttle. Cab was about $15, including a hefty airport surcharge and the shuttle service is $6/head. The room appeared clean with a reasonably large bathroom and nice showerhead, but weak water pressure. Hallway was pretty dreary. Biggest negatives on the room were that everything felt damp, the single desk-height outlet for the lamp didn't work, and no sleep timer on the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise stay, enjoyable time”
Reviews.Author: JojoT06
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Sydney we had our flight cancelled by virgin. They put us up in the Holiday Inn and we thought we were going to have an average at best stay. However, we found the hotel very nice and also the staff helped us out to ensure everything was comfortable. It was my mum's birthday and Glen made sure we had everything we needed. The rooms were a good size, clean and well equipt for all our needs. The food was really good and the breakfast was especially nice. I loved the juicer to make up fresh juices! We spent time in the Biggles bar when waiting to leave and found it comfortable and staff again lovely. We especially enjoyed our lunch, made by the lovely chef and pleased there was gluten free pasta available. I know we weren't paying for the room but we felt the hotel and staff were so nice I felt we should write a review. If we need to stay at the airport anytime in the future I would use Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest we've found in Sydney,very friendly staff & Great food”
Reviews.Author: MrMouser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight layover on way back to the US. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the front desk agent and asked for a crib it was in our room before we got up with the suit cases. The room was very clean the bathroom was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I went to the resturant to order food and she said I could have just ordered from the room. She took my order and saw I had my 1 1/2 yr old with me and asked if I wanted something for her. She said it was free for children. The order came up to the room in about 10 minutes very fast. The childrens meal was huge and what you would normally get as an adult at any other resturant in Australia. I should have just ordered if for myself there was so much food on it. My husband has lamb shank and it was very very good. I asked the lady who brought up the food if there was a coke machine on the property and she said she would get us whatever we wanted and brought them up right away. Such GREAT service and if we ever go back to Sydmey which we probably will we will definately stay here again. We had to make our reservations in such short notice for work purposes so it was very expensive but, at least it was clean, nice and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Southdown_Man
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly welcome awaited us here, dealt with promptly. Room was spacious and clean. Good selection of breakfast items and nicely presented and again a friendly welcome. Prompt and easy check out. A good hotel for a one night quick stop with a friendly feel

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenient but impersonal”
Reviews.Author: aussielover2
Reviews.Content: We used reward points to book our one night stay. The hotel is very close to the international airport..about a 10 minute train ride or catch the shuttle for a cost of $6 AUS (shuttle cheaper than taking the train and you don't have to schlep your luggage). We had an excellent view of the city from our room. The room was very clean and quiet. We had stayed in Sydney a few weeks prior at a different hotel, which was more centrally located than the Holiday Inn airport for touring around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: DrDemolition
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little on the expensive side considering it doesn't even offer free wifi. I only had to stay here one night it was close to the airport and made getting to our early morning flight easy. The hotel runs a shuttle to the airport which is an additional $6 bait of a rip off considering you have to go less than a kilometer and also once again the room rate should be more than enough to cover the cost of the shuttle. I wouldn't stay here if your a business travler as the Internet is expensive and not included. Also something which I thought was a little strange is that if you want your room service on a tray it's an extra $4.50 otherwise they just throw it in a paper bag and it free. That was bizarre!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: Having a late arrival and an early start the day after we choose the Holiday Inn, location is acutally off the airport so a taxi is needed. Check-in was efficient and friendly. The room was a reasonable size and okay, clean if slightly tired. After a good night sleep with no disturbance from aircraft noise we checked out to continue our journey. All the members of staff we came into contact with were pleasant, professional and courteous. There was free wi-fi in the hotel bar which is a bonus for an Australian Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than Stamford!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: We make regular trips through Sydney on our way to Perth. It requires a hotel stay on the return and sometimes at the airport. The Stamford has been our regular choice since it was a Sheraton. No more! The Holiday Inn was far better. Much better breakfast buffet and restaurant. Better service and easier to check- in. We are traveling with our teen daughter and rather than a rollaway they actually have rooms with a Queen and a single bed. The toiletries supplied were better than expected with everything for 3 people. Only 11$ from the domestic terminal or $14 from the International terminal by Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Formulaic, but high quality delivery”
Reviews.Author: peterkar
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week over Christmas. We think that we made a good decision: front desk, room and restaurant service were all excellent. The buffet breakfast was possibly the best I've had anywhere, at least in terms of the quality of its ingredients (the scrambled eggs were real, and you could otherwise have them any way you wanted them); and the continental breakfast showed careful preparation eg water melon without seeds.... and a big fruit selection). Good size room at a good price, meticulously cleaned every day, and transport either at the door (taxis and shuttle buses) or 150 yards down the road to the Mascot train station, two stops from Central on Sydney's extensive metro network.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, with good staff”
Reviews.Author: trevar
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport for a conference at the Novotel Brighton Beach, which was booked out. For proximity to Brighton, it was excellent, as long as you have the ability to avoid peak hour. The refurbished room was very comfortable. A few clues reveal its true age, but overall it's pretty good. They provide labels on the pillows to tell you which are firm and which are soft, which would be a good idea, if there was any difference between the firm ones and the soft ones! They all felt pretty damn soft to me, but I like a very firm pillow (a brick with some padding might possibly be firm enough for me ;-) ) The best feature of this hotel was its room service menu. As well as the usual $40 meals with an additional tray charge, they have meals in the sub-$20 bracket served take away style with no tray charge. The quality of the meals I had was impeccable, and the price made them accessible with the added advantage of being convenient. This kind of well-considered service innovation is something I've never seen before, and will bring me back. The only real inconvenience at the Holiday Inn was the parking. The hotel insists on holding your keys in case their valets need to move your car, but this makes me very nervous. It's also not easy for staff to explain, so I was even more unsure about using the carpark. They should be able to come up with a better system. Overall, I had a great stay and will certainly favour the Holiday Inn if I need to stay in this part of Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cri-t-q
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice for work purposes. Very near to the airport .Offers airport shuttle bus. Staff are courteous and welcoming. Room is very spacious, has a business desk, clean, comfy bed. Did not have problems having a good night's sleep. Not a holiday hotel as what many say - but really good for business travelers or overnight stay when your flight has been cancelled/delayed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first or last night hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-traveler-04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we flew out of Australia. It is about 200m to Mascot train station (easy walk) and a 10 min train ride to the city. We walked from the domestic terminal when we flew into Sydney which took 15 mins, but you can get a shuttle for $6. We stayed on the 9th floor and the room was spotless. We thought aircraft noise might be a problem, but we didnt notice it or road noise either. Not sure how the previous review can say the rooms are tired as ours was like new. We would recommend this hotel for value for money and ease to get to the airport and city.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night to recover from a long haul flight from London. There are shuttle buses located outside the international airport arrivals. Wait near bay 31 and ask the drivers which hotels they service. The cost was charged to my room (AUS$8 return approx). The room itself was a bit tatty in places, generally clean apart from hairs in the bathroom. Bed linen was clean and fresh. Aircon a bit noisy but i slept through it. Free tea/coffee facilities in-room). There's 2 breakfast choices: continental $16 or cooked $25. Continental was more than enough and the coffee machine was good. I didnt use the restaurant or any other facilities but aparently they have a swimming pool and a gym. At around AUS$200 for the night I'd say you are paying for the convenience more than anything else. Internet costs money to use. I'd recommend buying a PAYG mobile USB stick at the airport particulalry if you are staying in Oz for a while.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bwsSydney
Reviews.Content: Being a Priority Club member, I'm always looking for something special. This was our 3rd stay at this location and were again, not disappointed. Check-in was efficient and friendly-the room was as we expect, clean, comfortable and functional. The Bistro has a surprisingly pleasing menu and Chef Louis does a mean order of Buffalo Wings and grilled calamari! The main attraction is of course its proximity to the airports, provided you're not leaving in Sydney peak hour traffic! For a normally 5-10 mn. ride, we had a 20 minute+ ride from hell thanks to numerous traffic lights, not in sync. They do now offer a shuttle service which on a good day at a good time is a great service. Bonus features even for a short stay are the small but functional gym and pool. Like most HI, this is a good value stay, for an airport hotel. Having read 2 very scathing reviews, I have to say a) expectations for a basically "business"/"overnight" stay were unrealistic and/or b) the stay was not recent-budhen's comments are especially accurate-as for the i-net connection, I use a mobile wireless modem, but reallse this is not a practical option for OS travellers-it's like using hotel phone lines-avoid if you have other options!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: RainnIceberg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the odd Holiday Inn here in Canada for overnighters, as well as the odd one in Europe, and must say that I typically never have high expectations for this brand. However, I have always been pleasantly surprised with my stays at Holiday Inn. That is until I stayed at this one. The location is good - close proximity to the airport and a 5 minute walk to the train station. Very handy. Unfortunately, they do not have a free shuttle ($6 per person, per way) which is very odd for an airport hotel. The lobby looks good, though the corridors of the room floors are beginning to look tired and worn. The room is acceptable. Surprisingly spacious. However the bathrooms are very dated, and the extremely low flow taps and shower heads do not make bathing enjoyable. The towels in the room were in desperate need of replacement (to the point where some were so old they looked yellow compared to some of the others). The internet access is hideously expensive at this property. $10 for 2 hours or $28 for 24 hours. BOTH have ridiculous limits on data. The "24 hour" package has a data limit of 100 MB, which makes it very difficult to chat online with family when travelling abroad. And forget about trying to download a show or movie on iTunes for you flight home. Who has ever heard of a "24 hour" package with data limits? Especially limits that are that low? But the restaurant takes the cake. I stopped in for a quick bite to eat around 5pm before I had to leave the hotel to meet some people in town. They have an open air kitchen, and when I first arrived, there were about 8 people in the outlet. I ordered a sandwich and a beer. The prices were reasonable for an airport hotel, so I thought I had lucked out. Well soon, 30 mins had gone by, and my beeper that the bartender gave me to alert me when my food was done had still not gone off. I had gone into the bar twice at this point to use the restroom etc, and had noticed that the cook was no longer there (and in fact was now sitting on the patio in street clothes drinking beer). When I came back from the restroom, I asked the bartender where my sandwich was, and that I needed to go. If I had known it would take 30 mins, I would not have ordered it. She apologized and said she would try and find out where it was, and that the chef was coming from the other side of the hotel, as she motioned to the lobby. I assumed this meant that all the food orders were currently being made from another kitchen. Finally 15 mins more went by and no food. I was finally so upset that I went in to tell the bartender I no longer had time to wait. As I was walking in from the patio, the beeper went off. I looked over, and miraculously, there was another cook in the open air kitchen placing my sandwich on the pass. Unbelievable! So in other words, 1 cook was off at 5pm, and another one did not start his shift until half an hour later! At that point I simply felt lied to. I told her I did not want the meal, and that this service was unacceptable. She offered to "box it up for me" to go. That just made me more mad. Like I am going to eat my 45 minute long sandwich from a box as I run to my meeting. I told her I wanted a refund. I'd have thought that she would have at least comped the sandwich and my drink for the trouble, but not so much. I still paid for the drink. I was so disgusted with the service I actually got up an hour early so that I could eat breakfast somewhere else before leaving for the airport. Over all, I would NOT stay at this property again unless you are getting in late and simply sleeping a few hours before checking out. Additionally, there are at least 5 other hotels you can stay in within a 4 block radius of this hotel. Websearch the area before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: acgardiner
Reviews.Content: During a two week vacation in NZ and Australia I paid twice as much for this hotel as all others and it was infinitely worse than all others. The room stank, the plumbing was poor, the telephone didn't work (incoming or outgoing) nor could it be replaced since it was hard-wired into a wall outlet, and the front desk staff mislead me on finding directions (also they had run out of area maps). To be fair I have to admit that their restaurant was quite good and reasonably priced. This hotel should be torn down and rebuilt!

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalotuk
Reviews.Content: Well trained staff greet you at this modern hotel. Rooms well appointed but no windows to open, probably because of the air-conditioning and aircraft noise. Could get a little claustraphobic after a week there. Beds very comfy with a mattress topper added to ensure extra softness. Like the cable TV, very important for sports viewing. Pool a joke, really a plunge pool inside. Shuttle bus to the airport for a small fee but better than a taxi. You could walk from domestic in 15 minutes but too far from international. Not much around for shopping unless you go to the airport as the hotel is situated in an industrial area. Food in the restaurant is of good quality but not cheap. Wines a little expensive. Casual bar area has good drinks and some fast snack type food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: raetia
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on my return journey and everything was fine except the restaurant doesn't open on a Saturday night, so had to make do with a bar snack. Used the hotel pick up from the Domestic terminal and return to the International the following day, which was fine but beware there is a $6 fare each way, payable at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for overnight stay at airport.”
Reviews.Author: saintmaniac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel so i could be at the airport by 9am. It was a lovely room much bigger than the nearby Ibis, it would be suitable for a longer stay. Bed comfortable, bathroom was large for a motel near an airport and parking $15 which is reasonable and it was safe and secure. Hotel accessed by a lift from the carpark so good if wet. The Hotel is easy to find and very easy to get in and out of, by car, again much better than the Ibis. I was travelling alone and had no problem getting to and from it. My only complaint would be the $4.50 tray charge on room service. Breakfast advertised as $16.00 but was actually $20.50. Breakfast was good for $16.00, but for $20.50 a bit overpriced. I arrived early at 12 noon and was given my room. The girl on reception was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: j0belly
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a couple of times now - most recently in Oct 2011. The reception staff are friendlly and efficient. There is car parking underneath the hotel for $15 a night - about par for Sydney airport hotels. The rooms are 4 star standard - bed comfortable - not too firm and have both bath and shower. We've had room service and also eaten at the bar - both were quite good food and service. Breakfast buffet has a reasonable choice of food as well as omelette's to order. The rooms we had - had a view over to the airport - but were soundproofed so you weren't disturbed by the noise. Overall a good airport transit option.

Reviews.Title: “Serious internet ripoff!! Business users beware.”
Reviews.Author: IanWriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of several in Sydney that try to gouge guests with outrageous internet charges. The trick here is that your $25 dollars for a day's worth of internet in the room has a limit on its use. After a couple of hours of normal business use, you get a message that you have used too much and your speed will be slowed down unless you pay extra. Then, whether you pay extra or not, you are cut off completely if you are so bold as to transfer 1000 mb of data during your day's worth of internet usage. If you want to continue, you have to sign up for another $25 dollar's worth. It is quite possible to run up a daily internet bill of $75 + just by handling normal business files. I find this outrageous especially for a hotel that charges $300 for a room. The cheapest internet coffee shop in Sydney (or anywhere in the world, for that matter) doesn't impose limits on how much you download. This is just arrogant, unconscionable price gouging, plain and simple. I would not have stayed in this hotel had I known about this practice -- it made me feel more like a victim than a guest. I hope company comptrollers take note and instruct employees to avoid hotels that use this system. I will certainly have a word with mine. The hotel is quite inconvenient for airport use anyway, with its 2pm check in time and 11 am check out time. International travellers who commonly arrive in Sydney early in the morning may not care to cool their heels in the lobby until 2pm when their room is ready; and those with late afternoon departures may feel the same about being booted out of their rooms at 11. The shuttle from the international terminal to the hotel is very hard to find and rolls by once every half hour if you are lucky. It picks up passengers at an unmarked, unsheltered stand in the middle of the airport access road -- no fun if it is pouring rain. A better idea than being stuck here in airport nowheresville is to take a taxi or train into town, leave your luggage at one of the many pleasant hotels you can get for $100 a night less that this one, and explore some of Sydney's many attractions until your hotel lets you check in at a more reasonable hour like noon. This place is not worth the money, the location, or the irritants. You can do much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly fine airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy98110
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a night at a hotel near the Sydney airport, and chose the Holiday Inn, I guess for points. This place was great for that purpose. Front desk staff were friendly, room was fine, I didn't eat there but the restaurant/bar arrangements looked good. My only glitch was getting charged for internet access, which I shouldn't have, being PC Gold. I mentioned this on checking out, it appeared I had made a mistake somewhere when logging in, and the morning front desk staff were very apologetic, but said they couldn't fix it since it was a 3rd party provider. This was over Easter weekend, so they couldn't reach anyone to fix it, but gave me names and numbers and emails of people to contact to fix it. Well of course I didn't fix it, promptly losing the information they'd given me, but I did appreciate their attention to the issue when I raised it. Short version, I'd stay there again given a similar circumstance. Sorry I can't say more, I jsut got there, slept, got up, and left. ps--do not take a taxi to the hotel from the airport, unless you want an angry driver. He was pretty disgusted to hear where I wanted to go, so close to the airport, but I wasn't aware there was a shuttle, plus was tired. I gave him a very generous tip, he seemed a little better after that.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: MollyAust
Reviews.Content: Close to airport with a shuttle. Food and beverages rather expensive. Showing it's age with need of a make over. Staff ok and may have to wait to check in at the end of the queue. Buffet breakfast satisfactory but with no real option to eat anywhere else then you will have to make do!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: geographyguy_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night before flying out to the USA the next day. I found that the staff were snobby and there wasn't many towels, soaps etc provided in the room. The room was still exceptional and clean and the restaurants in the ground floor were most adequate for an enjoyable dinner and breakfast. There is sometimes a shortage of taxis, so try and travel to the airport well in advance of check-in to avoid a last minute panic.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LessThanEd
Reviews.Content: In relative to airport hotels this is what you expect, especially from a Holiday Inn. The staff was really good and helpful. Big bonus there. The bed was great. After little over 3 weeks on an average bed I was out like a light. The location isn't the best but it is an airport hotel so you can't expect much. A very short walk to the subway and a 20 minute subway ride you are at Darling Harbour. I spent 1 night and easily got down to the harbour without much effort. My main concern is a lack of a hotel shuttle. It left every 40 minutes or so from the hotel. Leaving the hotel isn't much of an issue because there are cabs and the shuttle if you can time it. Getting to the hotel is a pain. Trying to figure out where to get picked up was annoying so we opted for a cab. Luckily our cab driver just gave us a nasty attitude but still drove us. I would be pretty upset if waiting in that long line for cabs for a $18 fare so I understand his pain. The airport hotels should opt for a much better transit service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keza1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight before flying home to the UK. It is in a perfect location for the international airport. We caught the train from Sydney Central to Mascot and the hotel was a 5 minute walk from Mascot Station. Fantastic views of the airport and runways!! Check in was fast and effecient. Our room was a lovely size, with a king size bed and baby travel cot. A very clean hotel. The food is great value for money, with a good variety of choice. Would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stock standard, good value”
Reviews.Author: ryan_knapton
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this HI, but it does exactly what you would expect. Good sized, clean room, surprisingly well priced bar and room service, great basement gym, all Fox Sports channels, only 5-10 taxi from the airport. Good if you need to be close to the airport for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: Seat_1A_1B
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on a regular basis for work. As a priority club gold member, the check in process is quick and easy. Some of the rooms do show a small amount of wear and tear, but most of the time the stay in comfortable and pleasant. The food and room service can be expensive, especially when there is not a lot choice within walking distance. Staff are always easy to deal with, and up till noe have never had any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Time2venture
Reviews.Content: This is a very average hotel, quite conveniently located to the airport. We stayed here after the airine we were travelling on cancelled our connecting flight. The rooms are fairly basic. We requested a non-smoking room, yet it did smell like stale cigarettes. The bathroom was not clean. There was hair from previous guests everywhere and it made you question the general cleanliness of the place. Also, we noticed one of the other guests had ordered room service. Their tray was outside their room when we arrived at 4:00pm and was still sitting there at 10:00pm!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for catching zzzzs before a flight”
Reviews.Author: Desertdiva24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport and perfect enough for a layover before catching a flight the next day. The rooms are clean, but the lighting isn't so great in the bathroom. Hotel staff is friendly. The fitness center is not great, pretty much just a treadmill, and the pool seemed small. Note: if you get their late and the restaurant/bar is closed, you are stuck with room service. There is nothing else around.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Novajim2010
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel, closest to the Mascot train station, nice rooms for a night or two when you need to be close to the airport. You do not want to spend a vacation here, but for it's purpose, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Matt1972SnowLover
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport, extremely comfortable beds and pillows. Very close in price to the Ibis and Formula1, but far better bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but slightly aging”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: A convenient location and up to the standard of most HI Hotels. Bonus of tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Why can't many foreign hotels have this little extra for the comfort of guests.? Not everyone wants a fridge full of grog either. Full buffet breakfast was good. Room Service was more like take out with burgers arriving in a bag with chips. Burgers cold,poorly put together,wafer thin cheese more like paper; chips hot and nicely fried and cut. If I wanted take out I would have gone to Maccas down the road. Biggest let down was wi fi charges. $5 for 30 minutes on a room costing over $A150 is a bit rich. Surely free wi fi these days like in most overseas hotels, especially HI's should be a free service. I will stay here again, mainly for the convenience, but please note HI, little things count at the end of the day for me.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, courtesy and value”
Reviews.Author: geraldq
Reviews.Content: I enjoy short stays at the Holiday Inn at Sydney Airport. It's close by, my Priority Club Ambassador status means that it's always a two minute check-in and check-out, and includes an automatic upgrade. The morning paper is always there, courteous staff are standard and the value is unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. Similar to Stamford but cheaper"”
Reviews.Author: TheAusSmithFamily
Reviews.Content: We had an over night stay here in September, as we had an early International Flight the next morning. The young lady on check in was lovely - friendly, chatty and very personable. We had booked two rooms, 1 room was supposed to be 1 QN and 2 Singles, 2nd room 1 QN, however on getting to the rooms found 1 room was 2QNs and the other was 1QN and 1Single. On checking with reception, we were advised the Hotel had gone through a review process and they had changed their bedding configurations. I wish we'd been told this (or warned at the very least) as this was one of the main reasons we booked here. Travelling with 2 small children - having them share one bed is NOT fun (as I'm sure many a parent will attest). We survived the night but only just. The room itself was very clean, well appointed and the bathroom was lovely. Extensive beauty products in the bathroom, which was also lovely and clean too. The bar downstairs has a good selection of food and is nice and casual for a young family just needing somewhere to refuel. The air conditioner in the room did not adequately cool our room at all. This made sleeping hot and getting any reasonable sleep was difficult. We had the air con on the coolest setting as well but figured it was as good as we were going to get and did not contact Reception to see if there was a fault with our air con (Stamford Plaza seem to have this issue too - that is, we had a problem with their air con not cooling to an adequate temperature when we stayed there in 2010). The Sydney Super Shuttle is a great service although the driver of the service was not very friendly and seemed more interested in getting his money than good customer service. I'm afraid English was not this driver's strong point either. A positive though is it was on time. A very convenient service despite poor customer service. All in all a good stay. We would choose Holiday Inn Sydney Airport again over Stamford Plaza, despite the air con issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and nice people”
Reviews.Author: steve1708
Reviews.Content: Came straight here from another Holiday Inn that wasnt so good, as always its the front desk people who can make or break the stay as first impressions are important, these were really lovely and I wished I had been able to stay here for more than one night! The service system in the restuarant was different but worked!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an airpoort hotel”
Reviews.Author: msykes
Reviews.Content: pleasant stay at this hotel and a lot better than the Holiday Inns i have experienced in the UK Bar and bar snacks good value for an airport hotel and shuttle bus very convenient

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport and still very Quiet”
Reviews.Author: business-traveler-Mn
Reviews.Content: After a red eye flight, being given a room early in the morning so you can clean up is a blessing. I used the Sydney Super Shuttle to get to the hotel(runs about every 45 minutes). They charge the shuttle ride to the room. You catch it at the bus parking area 30-34 out side of the International terminal. The on site restaurant serves a nice choice at breakfast from cereal to hot dishes. The room was quiet, the bed was comfortable. If you have time, you are within a short walk of a rail station that will take you up to the city center for site seeing, Just ask the front desk for directions, they are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Easy, convenient airport stop-over, family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaHK
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a stop-over at Sydney Airport. Traveling with my husband, 9 year old and a 1 month old baby. Needed somewhere easy for an early start the next morning without the hassles of Sydney traffic. We had a nice dinner and great breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and kids stay and eat for free!! There were two very comfortable double beds in our room, so plenty of room for us all to sleep, and a cot was offered for our baby for free as well. Airport transfers were included in our room package which made our trip really easy. Must admit though that Sydney airport is not well sign-posted and finding the shuttle bus area was a bit difficult. All in all the hotel was clean, comfortable, easy and pleasant. Very family friendly and to a good standard. I would recommend it for an airport stop-over with kids. Make sure you leave yourself plenty of time for breakfast in the morning as it was one of the nicest hotel breakfast buffets I have had in a long while!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels-7
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that you would only stay at if taking an early morning departure from the airport, or arrivie late at night. The hotel is clean and comfortable, if somewhat starting to show it's age and need for soft refurbishment. The carpet in my room had some stains and the timber furniture trims were marked and a bit scratched. The TV reception wasn't wonderful. All the digital channels were available, but there were lines running through many of them. The bathroom was clean which is always of importance to me. The shower was over the bath, not stand alone. I am a Priority Club member and my membership was ackowledged at check-in and I happened to be staying on the evening of their weekly drinks reception for members. The staff were very pleasant, although I didn't make any particular requests of them. Shuttle bus the following morning to the airport was an easy transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: VicnHil
Reviews.Content: Hotel upgraded room. The room was clean and comfortable and air con problem was fixed quickly upon request. Our evening meal in Amelia's restaurant was very good and Biggle's bar was well patronised by the Friday night crowd, so must be good. Overall a pleasant stay.,

Reviews.Title: “Solid airport property convinient to the Domestic Terminals”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn sydney airport is not on airport property - it is appox 5 minutes drive from the domestic terminal - longer from the international. Up front - this hotel is in a better location (walk to Mascot station) and is of the same standard (if not higher) than the more expensive Stamford + you will get priority club points ;-) The 3 rooms I stayed in over a 2 week period (in and out of property 3 times, not moved about by hotel) were all renovated, featuring Holiday Inn's new signature beds / furnishings / amenities and were highly comfortable - ie 4.5 star quality. The tones of the property are subdued and comfortable, but not as comfortable as the bed - one word AMAZING. Downstairs in the lobby there is one restaurant and one bar. Amelias and Biggles (Still undecided if those names are coy cute or irritatingly bad) Amelias restaurant, the more formal area, seemed a touch overpriced, however the casual bar area Biggles was buzzing each night with a great wine by the glass list and bar menu (both snack and meal options). The only down side I can think of is the area... there is very little near by in way of restaurants or entertainment. That said, mascot station is a 5 minute walk away and can have you in the middle of the city in around 10 minutes. If I had an early flight (either domestic or international - its not THAT far) and lived out of the area I would not hesitate to book this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option near airport that caters for families too!”
Reviews.Author: jetranger
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night at either end of our NZ holiday and found the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport a good choice. A short taxi ride (which for a family of 4 was cheaper than the shuttle bus) from both domestic and international airports. Friendly staff on check in/out. The room was a little small given that it appeared to be a standard size room with 2 extra single beds however was clean and tidy with comfortable beds and pillows. The room rate was affordable compared to other nearby hotels and on one of our nights breakfast was included. This was very good with wide hot/cold selection and made to order omelettes. Would probably stay elsewhere for more than a couple of nights but perfectly fine for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a short overnight between flights”
Reviews.Author: StaffsStroller
Reviews.Content: Friendly and efficient welcome so that we could move swiftly to our room after a long flight. Large, clean, adequately appointed room. It was quiet and the bed and pillows comfortable. On the shuttle bus run to all terminals. Didn't have time to eat as arrived about ten pm and left about 6.30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the weary traveler”
Reviews.Author: 2NRL
Reviews.Content: After flying from Pittsburgh, PA to Sydney, this hotel was a welcome rest spot. The hotel was a very short ride from the airport and I was able to get into my room early (7am). The staff were nice and the room was clean and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kfer6
Reviews.Content: Stayed on our way out on holiday. This hotel is convenient to the airport. They process you quickly and the beds are fantastic! Value for money and very close to airport. They will hold bags for you until you return.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: hula11
Reviews.Content: As our domestic flight arrived late morning, we were delighted that we were able to check into our room early. Surprisingly being so close to the airport the Holiday Inn was very quiet. The staff & the facilities were great as was the lovely meal we had in Biggles Lounge & Bar The hotel is very close to both Domestic & International Terminals with only short trip into the CBD. Having airport transfer availablewas convenient this avoided waiting for a Taxi. The only problem was our hot breakfast was cold, which we brought to their attention. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel close to sydney airport.”
Reviews.Author: sharroncarson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight as we had an early morning flight. it was very comfortable and had great facilities. We had a really nice meal in the bar/ restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: meredithhtb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now prior to an early international flight, and found it very clean and comfortable. The beds are good and the room service menu has some reasonably priced options.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: twinklation1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to flying early the next morning. Lobby, bar & restaurants were great - rooms were a little tatty & old. OK stay, probably better for the money in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Holiday Inn in Australasia”
Reviews.Author: Christopher-Bean
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn - Sydney Airport is one of the worst Holiday Inn facilities I have every stayed in, second only to the Holiday Inn LAX. As a Holiday Inn Platinum member (315787289), I booked a standard room around a month before my overnight in Sydney. I was initially shocked at the price ($198.00 AUD / $220.00) but decided to go ahead and book at HI rather than the Mecure where I usually stay. Upon check in on July 2nd, I was not identified as being a Priority Club member (or Platinum at that), I was not offered any kind of room upgrade or bonus benefits. As I was only overnight-ing I decided not to make an issue of it. Reviewers will note the "worst" statement in my title so I'll outline specific issues and complaints: 1. Bath Room - The standard room (1025) had two dirty towels hung on the back of the bathroom door and streak marks in the toilet. There was also soap residue left from the previous guest in the bath tub. Disgusting. 2. Amenities - No free water was provided in the room. No welcome basket or fruit was provided. 3. Fitness - The fitness room sauna was broken. The hotel's "swimming pool" is nothing more than a 20 x 10 plastic tub in the ground. 4. In-Room Entertainment - The hotels room NTT Docomo entertainment and Property Management System / PMS is from the early 90's, crashed multiple times during attempts to order video services. I ended up paying $16.95 for a recent release movie but was charged an additional $19.95 for services I did not order. 5. Internet - No Platinum member complimentary Internet was provided in the room. 24 hours of access to a Connexus ~1 mbit DSL connection costs $27.50 AUD which is an absolute rip off. This is the first Holiday Inn I've stayed in which has no provided complimentary Internet to Gold and Platinum members. 6. Front Desk - I called the front desk twice during my stay, once to inquire about Internet facilities and a second time to ask about fitness facilities. Both times I spoke to reception staff they were very abrupt and seemed quick to want to end the conversation. Half of the 'Hotel Services Guide' in my room was missing, hence the reason I was calling for information. The gentlemen who answered my calls (front desk, mid-height, chubby, glasses) was quite rude directing me to the services guide rather than providing a simple answer. 7. Biggles Bar & Cafe - As I arrived after 6 pm, I decided to have dinner in the Biggles Bar on the 1st floor. I ordered a bottle of wine as well as fish and chips. I noted that the first bottle of wine I was given had already been opened (Penfolds Cabernet Sauvignon). Before even touching the bottle I politely asked the counter to change the bottle as it appeared open. She immediately began arguing with me. I kept a straigth face and said they could either change the bottle or cancel the order. Muttering under her breath, she proceeded to change the bottle out. The fish and chips were acceptable albiet a very small serving for the price. 8. Wake Up Call - I requested a wake up call for 6:30 am on the morning of my departure. As of 7:00 am none was provided. I may have missed the bus to the hotel had a customer call not come in 20 minutes before the bus left the hotel ($7.00 AUD from HI to Syd. Intl). Bottom line - don't stay at this hotel, Holiday Inn Priority Club member or not. Take your money and stay at the Mecure or Ibis. Both offer a much higher level of service, have newer facilities and far more capable staff. To Ian Pirodon (Hotel Manager) and the rest of the Holiday Inn - Sydney Airport's staff, I encourage you to address these issues with your house keeping, reception and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of staff”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular visitor at this hotel as it is quite close to the airport. They offer a shuttle service for a fee, but the frequeny was limited so this time I used taxi. I have always found the reception staff to be professional and outgoing, but this time I found they were simply not enough staff working. In 6 visits to reception I saw maximum of 2 staff and often lines. When I left my bag to be stored, I had to wait for front desk person (only 1) to become free to retreive my bag. This is not a small hotel, so lack of staff was surprising over 2 days. I found hall carpets to look old and worn. My room was comfortable and nice. Bed was great. Bathroom was updated and very well maintained. Internet was quoted as AUD $27.50 per day, but I was not charged. Parking was expensivem, but I forget the cost. No nearby stores that are close to walk to. Food was good in restaurant. If on my next visit the service is poor then I will not visit in future,

Reviews.Title: “Always happy”
Reviews.Author: Goanna111
Reviews.Content: Easy Fast check in helpful staff. Comfy beds & pillows. Room service fast & efficient always happy to stay her before/after flight.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ba340
Reviews.Content: Easy check in, close to the airport and well insulated from outside noise. Rooms in good repair and very clean. Beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, quiet and well priced”
Reviews.Author: minandprin
Reviews.Content: my partner and i overnighted at the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport prior to flying out for a holiday. We picked up one of their stay, park and fly packages which included a buffet breakfast. It certainly is not the flashest place we have stayed in, in fact the rooms are a little dated but the rooms are spotlessly clean, beds are comfortable and the buffet breakfast was very good. Included in the room rate was a free airport shuttle and secure undercover parking. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean, well appointed. good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gigglehat
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on Good Friday for a few days R+R . The front desk was very polite and friendly. We were pleasantly surprised, and accepted, the offer of an immediate upgrade (no extra cost). Woke to panoramic views from near the top floor. Down to full buffet breakfast (choice of eggs - perfectly cooked to order ) hot and cold with so many choices, yummy ! The stay over the next few days continued to be excellent, although we didn't try the restaurant. The bathroom and amenities were ideal and little touches appreciated. ALL the staff were extremely friendly and polite. A clean, well presented room with all our needs catered for. A short walk to trains made this an easy place to stay without the need for a car. If you take a taxi be careful. had problems both to and from the airport (overcharging and rude). nothing to do with the motel of course. In all will most definitely recommend Holiday Inn to friends

Reviews.Title: “Great go-to for airport trips”
Reviews.Author: mykenbo
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable, staff were friendly and the included car parking (with our park-stay-go package) is great. Room service was also pretty good, with a take-a-way style menu for easier eats. Burgers were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay Before Flying”
Reviews.Author: LKZ101
Reviews.Content: We flew in from Perth and stayed overnight here before starting the long trek back to the U.S. The taxi drivers had no problems taking us to/from the airport, even though it was a short trip. The front desk staff was courteous and helpful upon check in and whenever we had questions. The room was extremely nice, and most importantly, very clean. Extra towels were brought quickly. We thought the price was quite low for such a nice hotel. We arrived on Good Friday, and the main restaurant was closed so we did have to wait in the bar awhile for food. The buffet breakfast the next morning was excellent. The price for 1/2 hour of internet was $5--not bad for Australia. This is a great place to stay before flying but would recommend staying closer to the city for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Hbmeri
Reviews.Content: We used the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport during a stopover of two days between flights. It was excellent value for money. The rooms were clean and quiet with a large LCD TV (which was great because it was the night of "the wedding") and the staff on the front desk were nice and helpful. It's only a short walk to Ascot train station to get the train into central Sydney and only a few minutes on the shuttle bus to get to the airport. We didn't use the bar or restaurant or have any room service so I can't comment on that but as far as a nice quiet place with a comfortable bed after a 22 hour flight, it was great. The only negative is that there is no free wifi in the rooms and to have it is quite expensive but it didn't bother us too much and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for that early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: lee65
Reviews.Content: Had amazing service from the Front Desk when we checked into the hotel. Even though I had requested interconnecting rooms when making the reservation, and again when I confirmed earlier in the week, the two rooms were not. Not a problem for the gentleman behind the desk - quick flick of the mouse & two interconnecting rooms were ours. A female staff member quickly followed us up to open the door. The same Front Desk gentleman then delivered our rollaway bed. And then the same guy was back with an extension cord for my husband's sleep apnea machine. When we came back a week later to collect our car, he was back on the Front Desk again. I just sorry I didn't get his name because he is very good in his role and deserves a special mention by name. The main restaurant was closed due to the public holiday, but the bar & bistro was very suitable for us. The only negative - in the bathroom there was the "rattiest" plastic toilet seat on quite a good quality toilet. The seat was all fraying & very unsightly compared to the rest of the motel room. The shuttle bus was on time, & made the short journey to the international terminal in quick time. I just wish the driver had asked who were flying with [both us & the other group were on Virgin Pacific Blue] & he dropped us at the start of the Departures when Virgin is at the other end.

Reviews.Title: “poor service will not be back”
Reviews.Author: goswanniez
Reviews.Content: stayed in april for swans game, staff unfriendly, room service poor left food on floor by door straight after knocking. toilet dirty on arrival. check in very unwelcoming and check out just wanted my money, no how was your stay, travel safe! barely a hello. no help with taxis or directions, staff could not even tell me how far the scg was away! not happy, would never stay again. I come to Sydney every single weekend, will be finding a new hotel to accommodate me every week, somewhere where i'm not treated like a dollar sign. thanks for nothing! beware travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: BarneyAdv
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Glen when being welcomed at the front desk. He was very courteous & provided good advice re dinner, morning departure and shuttle service. The romm was very comfortable & the package for stay & park was good value and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer focus”
Reviews.Author: Newlyretired73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our third visit to this hotel after overseas holidays and it just keeps getting better. We were welcomed like friends, treated as VIPs and all requests met with a minimum of fuss. Great food, inspiring choices and comfortable ambience are all provided by a great team - the customer focus here is equal to the best we have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & good location - we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: finkiwi62
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults & 2 kids) stayed for a couple of nights at the beginning of January 2011 on our way back to Dubai from NZ. We liked the beds & the rooms, the breakfast was excellent (unhurried with excellent choice including â€œsqueeze-your-ownâ€� orange juice, nice lady doing all sort of eggs, coffee machine with different varieties of coffee) and the staff were helpful and efficient. Loved the fact that the hotel was 100% smoke-free, as some hotels have tried! to put us in what they consider to be â€œsmoke-freeâ€� rooms. This hotel is cheaper than others in the city (obviously as a result of the location) but we had no problem using the train from the Mascot Station to/from the city â€“ which will take you all the way down to Circular Quay which is close to the Opera House and where all the ferries leave from (Manly, Taronga Zoo etc) We travel frequently to New Zealand (OK I admit it Iâ€™m a â€œKiwiâ€�) from Cyprus (where I work) and always stop at Sydney to/from NZ for a â€œfewâ€� days to â€œbreak upâ€� the trip â€“ normally we stay at Hotels at Darling Harbour â€“ but this was the first time we had stayed at this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Our Tips: 1. If youâ€™ve got a night flight and are heading back towards Europe and the Middle East ask for a â€œday-useâ€� room (if possible) when you check out. OK itâ€™ll cost you maybe AUD $120.00 but when youâ€™ve got an 14 hour direct flight to Dubai ahead of you leaving at ten â€˜oâ€™clock at night itâ€™s nice to arrive at the airport after having rested and â€œfreshened upâ€�!! Airport tip: When leaving from the airport look inside for trolleys or it will cost you AUD $2.00 (per trolley) â€“ youâ€™ll have to be pretty quick as they are quickly collected and put back into the rack outside by enthusiastic uniformed staff (so theyâ€™re easy to spot!). This is the only airport in the world that I have encountered where you need to pay for luggage trolleys â€“ OK you need to â€œpayâ€� in Larnaca (Cyprus) but itâ€™s only a deposit like with shopping trolleys in Europe â€“ so at least you get your money back when you return it after checking in! 2. Thereâ€™s an excellent â€œSparâ€� supermarket just down the road past the train station around the corner. It has beer/wine/spirits and food of course! Gripes (only one!): 1. There is no mention on the hotelâ€™s website of the hotelâ€™s shuttle bus service on the â€œdirectionsâ€� page where it mentions â€œTransportation To and From hotelâ€�. If the information is there (and I am pretty sure itâ€™s not) itâ€™s â€œburiedâ€� somewhere in some obscure part of the site. We arrived at the airport from NZ (4 of us with maybe 5x bags/suitcases) â€“ we wouldnâ€™t fit in a normal taxi so had to try to arrange for a bigger taxi. Nobody wanted to take us because of the short 5-minute drive so we ended up basically begging for lady taxi driver to take us, loaded/unloaded all our bags ourselves and were charged about AUD $40.00 for the privilege. Sadly, I was too tired and stressed out to argue even knowing at the time that it was a â€œrip-offâ€�. On our way back to the airport we used the hotelâ€™s shuttle (AUD $6.00/seat) and it worked fine. We now have the shuttle bus timetable for next time â€“ shame we didnâ€™t have it when we arrived. The shuttle bus leaves from â€œBay 32â€� and from the International Terminal and you wonâ€™t have to wait more than 40 minutes (The first one of the day leaves at 06:50 and the last at 23:10). These details were correct as at January 2011. A good idea might be to get the hotel to email you a copy of the latest shuttle bus timetable. Observations (Only one very minor and petty one!): Sorry but I canâ€™t help myself (proof reading contracts and correspondence is part of my job!) but I couldnâ€™t help but notice the signs around the hotel which state something along the lines of â€œOur hotel is smoke free so you can breath (sic) easierâ€�. Iâ€™m no expert but am pretty sure it should read: â€œOur hotel is smoke-free so you can breathe easierâ€�. (i.e. â€œsmokeâ€� and â€œfreeâ€� should be hyphenated and â€œbreathâ€� should have an â€œeâ€� on the end. It was unusual to notice signs in the hotel of a major hotel chain, in an English-speaking country to be spelt wrong. In conclusion: We really liked this hotel and the location and would definitely stay here again. Knowing what we know now, next time should be even less stressful and more enjoyable. Travelling with young kids is stressful enough so trust this information will be helpful to other familiesâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional service and rude personnel”
Reviews.Author: Noo36
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid in advance but there was no record of our reservation on check in. Thank goodness I had taken my booking confirmation. Our room was comfortable enough and clean, but there were so many problems with the hotel and service it was laughable. - the 'pool' is in the basement next to the car park, is tiny and absolutely filthy - the on site restaurant was closed for a refurb - we were not given prior warning and then we were not allowed to eat in the bar with our daughter - room service forgot half the items we ordered - the airport shuttle bus is a disgrace. They tell you that you don't have to book, but then it gets very full and you can't get on and risk missing your check in. The drivers of the buses were like something out of a horror film - obnoxious, rude, shouting abuse at paying customers and to top it all, giving out incorrect information about airlines and terminals. There is nothing that would convince me to stay at the hotel again - I'd rather take an extra ten mins cab ride to the city and stay somewhere half decent where you dn't get treated like cattle.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay before flying out”
Reviews.Author: Racer520
Reviews.Content: I chose the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport as a place to stay prior to flying out early the following morning. We were greeted by friendly staff who had our room reservation already sorted. Our deal included accommodation, 7 days parking plus shuttle to airport and breakfast. The room was clean, well presented and comfortable. One thing, they did leave a 'skid mark' on the toilet bowl. The breakfast was fantastic and the shuttle was on time. Highly recommend this hotel, I will be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep but stay let down by bathroom cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: ThinController
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Sydney Airport is relatively close to the Domestic Terminal and is within easy walking distance if you don't feel like taking the shuttle or a taxi. Both check in and check out were easy, and the staff were professional and friendly. The room I was allocated was on the second floor and, with three lifts serving the hotel, I did not have to wait for a lift on any occasion. The room was quite spacious and, despite the hotel's location on a busy road, there was relatively little traffic noise. The airconditioning fan is quite noisy however. One thing which let the room down was the bathroom cleanliness - there were several long hairs in different locations on the bathroom floor. The bed was very comfortable and there is a choice of pillow hardness; I had an excellent night's sleep. The buffet breakfast was good, with a full selection of hot items including a choice of either American and English bacon. As noted by other reviewers internet access was expensive, but I had taken a mobile wireless card just in case, so didn't have to pay for internet. I also had dinner in Amelias and again the staff were very professional and friendly. Three of us staying at the hotel chose the swordfish for our mains, and it was done perfectly. The dessert selection was also very nice. I would stay here again, but hope that the housekeeping standard for the bathrooms improves! TC

Reviews.Title: “These guys are pros...”
Reviews.Author: DTGray
Reviews.Content: After several anxious days of delay of our holiday DownUnder due to blizzard conditions in the NE US and needing to rearrange our various accommodation and tour arrangements twice in 4 days, we applaud Holiday Inn's Priority Club for making our welcome so wonderful at this location in Sydney. We arrived jetlagged after 30 plus hours in transit to find a very clean, comfortable room with a nice view on the 8th floor at 10am in the morning! This staff knows to to take care of international travelers! The shuttle was reasonable. The room service just fine. Best of all Sunil Choudhary, asst. manager, and his staff worked very hard to insure a pleasant stay. With all of the confusion over our reservations due to flight cancellations, Sunil was very timely in helping us sort out the reservation issues we had experienced with the Holiday Inn reservation desk in the US! Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Fitts the bill but nothing fancy.”
Reviews.Author: agentk98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here since I had a connecting flight to Melbourne at 6am in the morning. My review is for that purpose alone. It was very close to the airport (in fact, the taxi was a bit dissapointed at how close I was). Room was sufficient but outdated. Views were uninteresting. Taxi's were abundant at check-out time (I even asked the concierge for a pre-schedule but she assured me there were a lot. She was right). Room service was ok. Stay here if you have need of being close to the airport. It's sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelKerr
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room. Breakfast choice was good and they waived my 80 year old mothers breakfast charge as she only had a cup of tea and a weet bix. Staff very all very friendly and made us feel welcome after a long flight from the uk. Felt it was rather expensive but would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous extra costs”
Reviews.Author: akuzi
Reviews.Content: Beware this hotel has crazy costs for extras, such as $27.50 for 24 hours or 100 MB internet access. Most people's monthly broadband bill is around that. And 100 MB limit - please! What year are we in, 2000?

Reviews.Title: “Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for overnight stay before overseas flight. The room was what was expected,not outstanding but comfortable enough to get some sleep before a long flight.That's if you like super soft pillows and matress (our rooms anyway) Check-in was fairly smooth but my main grumble with this hotel , GIVEN LOCATION, was staff not being capable of getting our wake-up calls correct. Our room didn't get one. we were contacted 45 minutes after the scheduled time to ask if we got a call! Room 2 got a call 20 minutes late and then another call 25 minutes later to ask if they got their call. If your going to offer a service, get it right. Definately not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Bonnyblink
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport but not within easy walking distance. Took taxi here from the airport and hotel offered reasonably priced shuttle service for the return journey. Rooms were standard fare with plenty of soap/smelly stuff. Didn't hear the noise from nearby busy road or planes. Bar was busy and prices were reasonable by Sydney standards. Menu was fine for an overnight stay with good quality cooking as well. Better than most UK Holiday Inns.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Traveller255097
Reviews.Content: Rooms didn't feel clean, and were very dated and basic. service was ok. I think for the price you can get much better for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by poor service and awful food”
Reviews.Author: Petal57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. The checkin and checkout service is always good, and rooms are clean and comfortable. The service in the bar in terribly slow- why? Is this area understaffed? I waited 15 minutes to order a glass of wine with only 2 other customers at the bar, with another 5 minutes before it was served. The food I ordered from room service was expensive and truly awful. Most of the fruit platter was inedible.

Reviews.Title: “The best Inn and service of all Holiday Inns we have experienced.”
Reviews.Author: cooperdixie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Holiday Inns all over the world, and this Holiday Inn in Sydney is the best service and stay we have experienced. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Another airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels are not the most exciting places on earth, and this is no exception. Or maybe it's because I arrived late in the evening and left early in the morning, but I hardly saw any other guests between check-in and check-out. The hotel looks quite modern, but once inside it shows its age. I was given quite a big room, although L-shaped so all you could see when entering the room was a corridor. And there's a good gym that's open 24 hours a day, but if you want to use the sauna at certain times it needs to be turned on. So it's an OK hotel, but please note that you'll need to take the shuttle bus or a taxi to get to the international terminal, its location is not that convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with easy access to the airport”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaGinger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel because we had 8am flight the next morning. We chose the $206 deal which included an overnight stay, return transfer to the airport, buffet breakfast and 7 night car parking, which is in our opinion a mega bargain! Check in was very smooth. There were two people serving at the desk and both were very friendly, helpful and efficient. We asked for a room on one of the top floors due to previous reviewers and we were very pleasantly surprised when we walked into our room. We had a corner room with an amazing view from both sides! The room itself was very clean, modern and their was definitely no rust stain on our bath tub. The toiletries were of high quality and they offered complimentary tooth brushes etc if needed which we thought was very generous. We ordered dinner from the take out room service. Our meals came in very cute boxes. My burger and fries was great but my husbands butter chicken was pretty average. But it wasn't expensive considering it was room service was we weren't upset. The bed and pillows were comfortable and we both managed to get a good night sleep. Because our transfer was set before the buffet breakfast was open we were given breakfast boxes to eat at the airport. They were only basic but it was perfect for eating on the run. And once again they came in cute little boxes! The shuttle itself was great but slower than I had imagined. I would definitely plan for the airport trip to take 30 minutes or more even though technicality its only a 10 or 15 minute trip. But once again we were very happy with it and the driver was nice and friendly. Picking up our car on our arrival home was no problem. We were in and out and on the road home within 10 minutes. We would definitely use this hotel again if we had an early flight. We were very impressed by the price and service. Overall its the perfect airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for near the airport”
Reviews.Author: CarolWellington
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay near the airport. Room was fine, Check in was quick and easy even though we came on the shuttle. Room was fairly quiet - always a hum of traffic. No charge for the shuttle coming to the airport . Don' t know if this was a mistake. We asked about the shuttle back to the airport in the morning, they said about 10 minutes.
