Well, when we came down in the morning we must have just missed a shuttle and my husband paid for the shuttle when we settled the bill, so 30 minutes later the shuttle finally goes. It was a total of 55 minutes to the terminal adding in the 30 minute wait before we arrived at the international terminal. Luckily we had allocated enough time. Next time I would take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Not too far from the Airport and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times before and it is really convenient. This hotel has everything you need for a short stay. The area has also changed and there are now some shops near the train station (2 minutes away). Found a hidden gem - the Japanese restaurant near the station called Ichiro's is very good and great value. I wished I had found this place sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent for airport and business”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: After arriving on an overnight flight, it was a big help that the hotel accomodated my early arrival. I found the reception staff to be great and easy going. I had some minor requests and all were handled quickly to meet my needs. I was upgraded due to my Priority Club status so I was happy. Bed was so comfortable I hated to leave. Paid car parking and paid internet are two negatives, especially the paid internet. Basically robbed me. Housekeeping ignored the Do not disturb and called me to ask if they could clean the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a layover”
Reviews.Author: chilopoda2
Reviews.Content: Clean room, efficient check-in, and very convenient location to the airport. I had a comfortable night's sleep before my long trip home. Wish this hotel had been a little bit less expensive though...then it would be a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place dont use their Broadband”
Reviews.Author: HEC44
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, handy to airport and railway station, comfortable spaicous room. friendly/helpful staff. Cups were dirty with no tea bags when we checked in, Broadband prices are way too expensive and plans are confusing. We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: jdandjm
Reviews.Content: As a stopover of just 12 hours, we didn't have much time to sample any of the facilities other than the room and restaurant. We used the hotel shuttle and were were dropped off right at the main entrance and large modern foyer. Check-in was fast as there was almost no queue. Booked tickets for the return shuttle. The room was quite spacious and had all the regular features. Large windows gave us a view over the Mascot business area and the airport. Comfortable QS bed with good reading lights. Good sized en suite. Large wide-screen TV with Foxtel and in-house movies, but it's still analog so the image is stretched and a bit fuzzy. We had a meal at Amelia's Brasserie. Good food and reasonable value but delivery was a little uncoordinated. Not so good: Only shelf space for one suitcase. Our other one had to be opened on the floor. Noise: We were on the road side so had muffled traffic noise until about 1am. No aircraft noise. If noise is an issue, ask for a room facing the entrance side.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Perisphere
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on a number of occasions and found it to be most satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, hassle free service”
Reviews.Author: ParadisePreachers
Reviews.Content: We chose H/Inn near the airport because we had an early flight out in the morning. The appeal was the deal they had with 7 days free parking. Great! We had a room where we could see the planes take-off and arrive. Cool! The bed was so comfortable which was a definite plus. Always good to have a decent sleep before travelling. The staff were excellent. They really were. Nothing seemed too much trouble. We had an added bonus of a full buffet breakfast included in our stay and it was very good. Even take-away coffee cups. When we arrived back from our trip, we simply got our key from reception and drove home. We wouldn't hesitate to come back, as we had a comfortable nights stay and we knew our car was secure while we were away.

Reviews.Title: “STANDARD HOLIDAY INN”
Reviews.Author: gplk
Reviews.Content: You more or less know what you're going to get at a Holiday Inn and this is no exception, The rooms are a bit tired and need doing up. No real complaints though and it is convenient for the airport. Also the train station - which once you get there is certainly handy for getting down town - is not directly over the road as other reviews imply, but rather several blocks away and a good 10 minute walk. Didn't have time to sample the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise upgrade made our evening great.”
Reviews.Author: MarJan6861
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel, we were hesitant to stay here prior to our departure from Sydney. But we were pleasantly surprised. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Because it was a Friday night and there were no business persons checking in and because we are priority members, we were upgrade to a beautiful two-room suite. What a delightful end for our three weeks in Australia! We then had a memorable dinner at their restaurant, Ameliaâ€™s and a tasty chocolate fondant dessert. Desk staff reserved a 7:15am taxi and it was right on time. However, there were other taxis available for early morning departures. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All expectations met”
Reviews.Author: MsFiveStar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had an early morning flight to catch the next day. After reading reviews of several hotels in the area we chose this one and were very happy with our choice. We took the advice of one previous reviewer and walked from the domestic terminal after arriving at 9.30am. The weather was pleasant and the walk was easy, although we stopped and asked for directions more than once as we had neglected to bring a map with us! The walk is straightforward enough though, walk out of the Qantas terminal, turn left and then turn left once more when you reach the Stamford. Keep walking up the left hand side of the road until you see the Holiday Inn - it's enormous and you can't miss it! I booked the most basic room directly on their site and requested an early check in and a room on the 3rd floor or above (after reading complaints about bar noise on the lower floors). Both requests were met and we were in our room by 10.15am. The room appeared to have been recently refurbished, and was completely comfortable with everything that we required for our short stay. The carpets in both the room and the corridor were in very good condition, the bathroom was very clean with sparkling white grout on all the tiled surfaces, although there was a rust spot on the bath near the plughole. We didn't notice any strange noises, the shower pressure was excellent, the bed and pillows were comfortable, the airconditioning was able to be adjusted to suit our requirements. The windows seemed to keep pretty much all the traffic and airplane noise out. We slept as well as you possibly can when you have an early morning flight to catch and you are worried about oversleeping your alarm! We walked to the nearby train station (a comfortable 5 minute walk), bought a ticket from the ticketing machine and caught a train into Circular Quay for lunch at Cafe Sydney. On arriving back at the hotel we enquired about the availability of taxis early in the morning and were advised that they need to be ordered before 6am and take approximately 15 minutes to arrive. After that time there are usually taxis waiting at the front door. We ordered our taxi as we were checking out and it arrived within 5 minutes. We ordered room service from their special take away menu that night as we couldn't be bothered leaving the room again once we had settled down on the bed in front of the television. The food was delivered in 20 minutes as promised on the menu. The food is packed into takeway containers and the delivery consisted of a staff member handing you the food complete with plastic cutlery. I had nasi goreng, which was a huge serve, piping hot and fresh, but rather bland. My husband had one of the pizzas and some garlic bread which he described as ordinary. As we hadn't been expecting anything special, we weren't disappointed. The price was comparable to buying the same meal for home delivery and all in all it met our expectations. Pretty much like the the entire hotel really. Nothing special, but exactly what we required for a one night stay before our flight the next morning. Neither myself nor my husband could think of anything worthy of complaining about. All of our expectations for an airport hotel were met, and bonus points for the early check in and giving us the floor we requested.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastandrew
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is an average airport hotel and serves it purpose well of being a place to stay waiting for your connecting flight. It is very close to the airport and we had no problem getting a taxi to the hotel and it cost less than $10 to get there. The rooms are fine and seemed clean. It's a standard fit out and the room was quite large. There is a bar/cafe downstairs perfect for an evening trip. If you need somewhere to stay for the night at the airport then Holiday Inn is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Sad, Smelly and Tired”
Reviews.Author: SteffanOfSouthport
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because everywhere else was full, I know why this place had vacancies, overpriced, Deluxe room wrapped around the elevator shaft place stunk, food was lousy and staff poorly trained and poor attitude, never again Furniture, fixtures and staff all due for overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled its function as a short stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJLBewdy
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight prior to flying overseas. We find this more relaxing than facing traffic or transport hassles before departure. Check-in service was efficient and friendly and our room was pleasant and clean. We booked the stay through WotIf as a $99 mystery hotel - it was patently obvious that the hotel on offer was Holiday Inn so not too much of a mystery really. The hotel is in the midst of commercial/industrial desert so probably not an option if you actually wanted to do anything other than sleep and travel to the airport. We paid for breakfast which was reasonably priced and quite good quality. We caught the shuttle bus to Sydney International - this was oversubscribed which meant we had to wait while the shuttle company sent over a second minibus - we weren't in that much of a hurry but this would be annoying if time was pressing. Overall we felt that the hotel fulfilled its role and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Food was Overpriced and Atrocious”
Reviews.Author: Schnuk
Reviews.Content: Location was good and the room was of a decent standard. Nothing particularly bad to note there. However the food was another story. We ordered a risotto from the ridiculously overpriced menu and i honestly have never tasted anything worse. I don't know who the chef is there but he should perhaps try his hand at working for pedigree chum instead. I suppose you could suggest people eat elsewhere but considering its an airport hotel, there aren't really many choices (which is probably why they get away with charging through the nose for terrible food like this). Would definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport and Qantas headquarters”
Reviews.Author: ymff
Reviews.Content: Location: Close to Sydney airport. From Airport: Hotel shuttle bus serves a handful of airports, charged AUS$6. Parking: Did not use. Check-In: Looked like it would be slow with a bunch of airline crew checking in and only one person at reception but another person showed up and then checkin was quite fast. Elevators: Fast. Room: 926. Large longish room separated into bed and sitting sections. Furniture looked dated. Room Lighting: Average lighting. Windows: Floor to ceiling windows along one long wall. Good blackout curtain. View From Room: Airport area and Botany Bay. Room Cleanliness: Clean and kept clean. Bed: Clean. Firm. Option of firm and soft pillows. Bathroom: Old fashioned fittings and lighting but well lit. Average amenities. Water pressure strong. Hot water was hot. Room Service: Very fast. Food OK. Desk: Good size for working. Good table lamp. Power sockets low in wall near floor. Desk Chair: Very low height. Phone: One at bed and none one at desk. Couch: Comfortable sofa set in sitting area. Internet: Expensive AUS$ 27 - good speed. Safe: No safe. Drawer Space: Limited. TV: Large LCD. Several channels. Alarm Clock: Yes. Iron: Iron in room. Robes: Yes. Slippers: Yes. Fridge: Minibar fridge has limited space for other items. Drinking Water: None provided. Tea and Coffee: Complimentary tea and coffee, plus cookies. Turn Down Service: Not offered. Air Conditioning: Very efficient. Noise Level In Room: Some airplane noise during day but with night curfew room was quiet. Morning Newspaper At Door: Yes. Staff: Very friendly. Breakfast: Continental breakfast good quality and plenty of choices. Pool: More like a large bathtub in a small room in the basement. Sauna/Steam Room/Jaccuzi: Sauna in basement but did not use. Wake Up Call: Call came at exactly the time requested. Check Out: Friendly, fast, efficient. Charged fee for using credit card. To Airport: Hotel shuttle bus charged AUS$6.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Airport”
Reviews.Author: alicep063
Reviews.Content: Handy to the airport--Friendly Reception.--Double Glazing. --Under cover parking ($15 a night) I thought $55 for a rollaway for a child was a rip off though

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: NW28
Reviews.Content: We overnighted at this hotel after arriving late evening. We had arranged a very good rate so it worked out to be great value. We walked here from the airport (approx 10-15 min walk) so didn't have to worry about queuing for taxis or waiting for the shuttle bus. It was easy enough to walk along the footpath once we had sorted out where we were. The hotel and the room were bright and clean with all the facilities you would expect. Our room appeared to have been recently renovated although I think the bed was a double (unexpected but no big deal). It is very quiet considering the location. The bathroom has a good layout and the shower was clean and relaxing. The room wasn't huge but it was ample with a desk, chair, flat screen tv and wardrobe. No extras were included (eg very basic toiletries, no bathrobes) but none were expected so this wasn't a let down. There was a short wait at check out while some people disputed the bill - there were other staff milling around so it was a bit frustrating waiting while they did other things. Overall - I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Other airport hotels better”
Reviews.Author: Oga1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a secret hotel with Wotif. Every time I have used Wotif, the check in staff acknowledge my special requests, but not this time. We like to stay on as high a floor as possible and requested this. The reception proceeded to check us into a room on the 1st floor. We had just flown for 22 hours and couldn't be bothered objecting. The room itself (number 122) was small and uninspiring, but clean. We noticed that there was a plastic bag tied tightly over the smoke detector - probably from a previous guest who wanted to smoke undetected in the room. A bit of a safety issue, we thought, but, being tired, just wanted to collapse into bed and get a good night's sleep. When we pulled back the doona, we found that there was no top sheet - just the bottom sheet and the doona. A European custom, I would have thought, not an Australian one. We absolutely hate having no top sheet, but managed to sleep reasonaby well as the bed itself was comfortable. We appreciated the pillow menu. On check out, we informed the counter staff of the plastic bag and lack of a top sheet and stated that we probably wouldn't choose to stay there again. Staff were most polite and told us they thought there should have been two sheets as well as the doona. We found both the Mercure (some rooms with opening windows) and the Stamford (total comfort) to be better choices for a Sydney airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NewtoAustralia
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned that I would be unhappy with my selection to stay here, but I was so pleased with my stay that I promised myself I would review as soon as I completed my trip. I had a forced overnight at SYD airport due to flight connections to the US from my hometown in Australia. I booked a room on WOTIF for a great rate (hint 1 of the mystery airport hotels was this one) The check-in went smoothly, but I had a wait a while as I arrived just after a shuttle full of people checking in and there was only 1 person on the desk. After about 5 minutes. 2 more people came out to help and it went much faster. My baggage was delayed and the front desk clerk kindly sent up a bathrobe for me to sleep in and the sign in the bathroom said that they would have provided tooth brush/paste, razors, etc... if I had needed those as well. Dinner in the bar was quick and good, My luggage was sent up once it had arrived. The buffet breakfast was well presented and a good value. The rooms seemed to be recently renovated. The only downside being the ugly 1970's side tables next to the bed and a small rust ring around the tub. Really those are minor complaints and I was struggling to find any faults. The bathroom was sparkling clean and white and the amenities were nice. I had a great sleep, (pillow menu is a nice touch) and there was a nice view of the airport. The location is perfect if you need to catch a flight but probably not a god choice for taking in Sydney sights. I checked in and printed out boarding pass from the biz center. The front desk also transferred a call to QANTAS baggage services from the lobby for me. Thank you for my pleasant stay! Tip: was to ride the cab from domestic terminal (cost me 9$ and no need to mess around with the shuttle) but reserve a seat on the shuttle to the International terminal for 6$.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Nights Rest”
Reviews.Author: Wolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before an early flight. The hotel is 200 metres up a slight hill from Mascot train station. A taxi to the international terminal was $15. Check in was simple, friendly and efficient. The room was clean and well equipped. We had a good view of the airport. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. We both slept well. Check out was a mirror of check in. This hotel is a good example of what Holiday Inn does well. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in town instead”
Reviews.Author: kupunakane
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok but nothing more. Although they call it an airport hotel, it takes a while to get between hotel and airport. The web site says "a nominal fee applies" to the hotel shuttle. In fact, for two people, the shuttle was more expensive than a taxi. When we checked out and asked if there was a taxi at the front of the hotel, the man asked why we didn't take the free shuttle. When I said I was told there was not a free shuttle (I had called before we left on our trip), he seemed surprised. The hotel is ordinary and not convenenient to anything.

Reviews.Title: “handy for airport”
Reviews.Author: time0ff
Reviews.Content: Booked in advance so got quite a good deal. Had booked a family room. When we got there given room key to find room had one double bed, when explained to reception they explained they had run out of family rooms & quickly upgraded our room to a king sized executive room & helped move all the luggage. Can't complain at that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: hunch
Reviews.Content: Including breakfast we paid $345 for two people! The computer system did not work at checkout so guests were required to fill out long forms. The staff were surly. They forgot toprovide chits for the airport transfer. Although we were told that a bill would be sent via email none arrived--the money was simply taken from the VISA account. There has been no reply to the message of complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were terrible and rooms are musty”
Reviews.Author: traveller666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before flying home. The romm looked ok whne we first walked in but we had twin beds that sank in the middle. They had tried to disguise this by filling it with mattress cover covers. We werre hoping for a good night sleep as we were flying back to Canada. We had the worst night of our vacation. The rooms smell very musty. There were 2 restaurants and the food was OK at both of them. Our wake up call did not happen nor did the alarm clock in the room. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in Middle of Nowhere with a Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: photonetau
Reviews.Content: A bit concerened when I saw a large cockroach walking across he floor in my room and this was the 5th floor! Nothing at all around the hotel, was told by a staff member thats its a short walk to shops its actually at least 20 mins and you wouldnt want to do it in hot weather To far from the Airport for a good view but close enough for easy access. Only stay if you are using it for the convenience of airport access.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Dillboy
Reviews.Content: Used the super shuttle to the hotel and back, this was charged on my room. What I was not aware of was not only was there NOTHING around the hotel, there was NOTHING around the hotel at all. The front desk told me two times the wrong directions to the local "Caltex" convience store (Circle K, Cumberland Farms) to purchase smokes that were not sold out of the Cigarette machine. There was a overpriced mini-bar in the room. The menu on the elevator/lift was not the same menu that was being served any more in the restaurant. I got stuck with a $20.00AU food bill that my dog would not eat. Service in the bar was what you would expect in a neighborhood bar, the help was looking to socialize rather then work. If I could have called the health inspector on the place I would have. The room was a different store. OUT DATED 1970s is what you want you got it. It was stepping back into a james bond movie just trying to work the light in the room.(See the attached pictures). The bathroom exaust fan was DIRTY. When I inquried about internet access in the Busienss Center I was informed that there would be a CHARGE, even though I am 10+ yr Priority Club member. My night was a reward night and if I had paid I would have wanted 100% back.

Reviews.Title: “save time”
Reviews.Author: Karoltila
Reviews.Content: Got an early flight from Sydney but hating getting up too early, that why I was very happy to stay at Holiday Inn Sydney Airport. It helped me to avoid the Sydneyâ€™ traffic and save my time to get to airport. The hotel was closed to the airport, very easy to access to both domestic and international terminal. More over, the hotel room was clean and fully furnished. Staffs were friendly and helpful. Staying here is a good option for someone who is in transferring or donâ€™t want to miss an important flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent to stay in sydey while transfering”
Reviews.Author: explorerBangalore
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel to stay if you are staying in Sydney for a day or two and then need to fly to other places. The hotel is clan and caring. very close to the Sydney airport. it take 15minutesride in the metro railway to reach the city center, harbour. The metro station is just 50meters walking distance. it has two resaturents and bars. very good view of the city from the hotels. Very clean, full facuility with internet, TV, Spa, Sauna, Gym, Pool.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Airport; Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: SouthGA_DAWG
Reviews.Content: This was a last night stay from an extended stay in NSW and QLD. I chose due to past experience with Intercontinental Hotels and the ease of access to SYD. I was very impressed with the hotel staff and ease of check in. I had arrived earlier than expected (9am), but they allowed the early check-in and a platinum upgrade. this allowed for a quick refresher before an all day Sydney excursion. The room was clean, comfortable, and a great layout and view. It is just what the weary traveler is looking for. Rest was easy due to the quiet, and the lavatory ammenties were amenable. The hotel is a short walk to the rail line. the only drawback is the extra access fee charged at this location by the rail operators. The airport taxi ride is a short one and relatively inexpensive ~$10AUD. The next time I am fly through Sydney, i will definitely look at staying at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Stopover”
Reviews.Author: gavve60
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night due to early flight. Got a great summer deal of $99.00 on their website. Friendly staff at check in/out. Had a corner room on 8th floor which appeared to be recently rennovated. Room was comfortable, a good size, desk and chair with all amenties with a bonus of watching planes take off at night. No noise at all. Used room service which was reasonably priced and a good selection of meals. Good choice of TV channels. Caught shuttle from domestic terminal (shuttles for hotel pickups outside terminal, ask terminal volunteers who will direct you if needed) and return to international. $6.00 each way. Leaves around every half hour (needs to be booked at reception). As stated, surrounded by offices but if you are only there for a night of no consequence. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Choice Near SYD”
Reviews.Author: MobileResident
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on two separate one night stays to catch early morning flights out of SYD. I made my reservations on the Priority Club web site. I opted to take a cab to and from the hotel to SYD. It was about $10 to the Domestic Terminal and about $15 to the International Terminal. There were a number of cabs in front of the hotel each of the two mornings I had flights to catch. The property is dated and the hallways aren't fresh. You should avoid getting a room on the second floor because of the noise on this floor from the lobby atrium. The rooms I stayed in were dated but they were clean and quiet with a comfortable bed and good functioning bathrooms. I do not regret deciding to stay at this property because it was convenient and reasonably priced but not remarkable in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Only if need to be near airport”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: 12-13 September 2009 Room #901 Large room next to elevator-no issues with noise. TV with about 12 channels. King sized bed and double sofa bed. Desk with chair-complimentary internet due to my Gold Priority Club status-no laptop so they gave me free access to computers in lobby. Bathroom with tub/shower combo, sink, and toilet. All amenities provided as usual at Holiday Inns in Australia. No available outlets by bed but hotel provided an extension cord (for 20$ AUS deposit) that would reach from desk area. Some available outlets in bathroom but none other found in room. Big negative-Restaurants Main restaurant closed on weekends except for breakfast (didn't eat breakfast so no comments on quality/availability). Hotel has bar with sandwiches which are priced between 15$ and 20$ AUS. Closed restaurants entrees were over $25 AUS according to menu in lobby. Bar food not the greatest-nasty tasting hamburgers-McDonalds would have been better but too far to walk. Had no idea how much I was paying for drinks but found out at check out that my charge for 2 burgers with chips, 2 beers for me, and 1 wine for friend was 48$ AUS in total. Would recommend trying to find something better if willing to walk. Hotel down the street had restaurant but did not check out their menu or prices. It couldn't have been worse! Airport shuttle available for 6$. Runs about every 35 minutes-book in advance and pay at front desk. Easy access from Mascot train station. Go out of station and take left on Bourke Road. It's a very short walk-hotel is on left just past the bus stop. It costs less than 6$ from downtown to Mascot but almost 15$ to airport from downtown-only a few km further but almost 9$ more! I would stay here again if I have an early flight. No big issues except with the food selection. People were friendly and seemed to care about their guests except for the guy who checked me in-he seemed to not acknowledge my Priority Club status but did finally mention that I had been upgraded when I asked about a room with two beds-all they seem to have are rooms with twin beds. View of room over airport was nice and far enough away not to be noisy. If you need to stay near the airport, then this is probably the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “No running water & Toilets wont flush”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravellet
Reviews.Content: Hotel left a pamphlet in the room advising us that there wont be any running water between midnight til 4am because they are upgrading/fixing hotel plumbing. By the time we check out at 10am, there was NO running water at all. Worse of all, the toilet wont flush...Of course, when i realized it, it was TOO late. We were advised to use the gymn toilets/shower, by then hundreds of hotel guest have been given thesame advise. We had to go to a party w/o a shower...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad eventually”
Reviews.Author: andyoz
Reviews.Content: I was booked here by my company for a 2 night stay as the course I was attending associated with the airport. I know Sydney well and know Sydney airport well. I will break down my experience... CHECK IN.. The staff were welcoming and polite and checked me in immediately. Check in was fast and friendly. LOBBY..This seems to be an open area with access to the bar and restaurant. It is uncluttered and simple to check in and out. There were enough staff to handle the volume of check ins and outs. It's an atrium style with enough seating to cater for the transient customer, plus a very comprehensive brouchure desk and monitors with flight status. ROOM..Initially I was allocated a room on the 1st floor. I was in there for all of 30 seconds and had to change. That floor is above the lobby and I could hear every conversation. My next room was much better, on the 2nd floor and a corner room at the very end of the hallway. Room appeared to have been updated, different look to the first room. It was spacious and consisted of double bed (not queen) desk, chairs, full internet access at a price, limited minibar but quite acceptable. I was more than happy with this new room. BATHROOM..I was quite impressed. It is spacious and very clean. Towels were good, there were amenities provided, although basic I feel they provide more than some 5 star hotels. Of course with Holiday Inn if you forget an item they are happy to supply you with it unlike 5 Star hotels like Stamford which charge $6 for a toothbrush. LOCATION..It's an airport hotel which I found frustrating, coming from Sydney, knowing that there is so much more for a $30 one way trip in a cab to the city. There is not even a convenience store nearby. The closest activity/shops are in Mascot, about a 15 minute walk. It's not a bad stroll and you can get Italian, Thai or Chinese but it is a walk. There is nothing around this hotel besides offices. Trains to the city depart every few minutes and the station is a 2 minute walk, direct link to the city. PRICE OVER ALL...I have stayed at Stamford Airport and disliked my experience there. Although not as luxurious the Holiday Inn it's a much better alternative. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight airport stay”
Reviews.Author: liliz
Reviews.Content: Although the family rooms are pretty small, that would be the only thing I could complain about to tell the truth! The staff were excellent and very helpful. One or two from the restaurant were very slow at times but nothing too major. They gave us late check-out promptly when asked, and just as well because the buffet breakfast was absolutely delicious!!! Great for a stop-over!

Reviews.Title: “Arrived jaded....Left refreshed.”
Reviews.Author: zarathustraperth
Reviews.Content: Myself and three family stopped o/night at this most convenient airport hotel. The check in was very quick, the rooms were average in my experience yet clean, quiet and well appointed. This hotels kitchen and bar facilities excel, the food and service were simply top notch. My tip is to try the Inn burger....WOW. We left the next morning refreshed and eager too continue on what was a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stop over”
Reviews.Author: tomsab
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel upoin recommendations I found on Trip Advisor. Reviews were quite dead on. Probably the best hotel around the airport. Arrived late and ordered room service which arrived on time and meal was very tasty for a hungry teenager. Check in was easy. We purchased the hotel with advance purchase breakfast to save few bucks. We met my cousin in the downstairs restaurant and she was able to get a free meal along with my daughter even though I only paid for 2 adult breakfasts. They didn't really seem to care who walked in for breakfast. My wife thought they had a lot to offer for breakfast so it's important to keep the wife happy. We took the cab in from the domestic terminal as it cost us only $12. We decided to book the shuttle for $6 a head and it turned out cheaper than getting a cab as the international termianl is much further from the hotel than the domestic. So take a cab if flying into or out of the domestic terminal. Shuttle is a better to and from the internationl terminal. Overall a pleasant stay. Nothing special but comfortable. Had no time to check out any of the other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 1 night stop-over”
Reviews.Author: deathracer
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the Holiday Inn, Sydney Airport hotel on a one night stop-over. The hotel is situated a 7 minute cab ride from the terminal. Check-in was friendly and efficient. With my gold priority card, I was upgraded to an executive room on the 10th floor. My room was large and well appointed. Features, pluses and minuses + Very clean and good modern decor (ambience) + Large windows with good views + Comfortable bed + Great ventilation system - a single knob for temp and a fan control + Free coffee/tea + Well stocked mini bar area, including real glasses + Good work desk area with wired internet (cable supplied) + Abt a 42" flat screen TV + Room seemed very sound proof + Bathroom a good size and modern + Water temperature and pressure excellent + They have full room service - TV only gets about 13 channels - Carpet is somewhat dark There is a modest style gym with 2 good treadmills, 2 stationary bikes, 1 stair master, and 2 weight machines......but the weight machines are not that great. Suggest to add free weights or a newer model weight machine I ate dinner in the bar, which was OK. The servers were not very friendly or engaging. There is no boutique or small store to purchase items at. Since the hotel is situated in a light industrial/commercial area, there are no restaurants in the area (accessible by foot), however the reception desk directed me to a Caltex service station a 10 minute walk away, where I was able to purchase a few items (tooth paste, snacks) I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Does the job -- some small hiccups upon checking-in though”
Reviews.Author: middlemanontheroad
Reviews.Content: I checked in last Sunday evening around 10 pm. It took a bit of time though before I actually was able to get my room card and get into my room as the check-in staff told me they were verifying the details of my stay (my stay was arranged through a travel agent but I had never had problems with this arrangement). When I got into the room, I wanted to charge my phone but found out that 3 of the 4 power points on wall were dead. The TV also didn't work (probably the power point for the TV was dead as well). I called the front desk and told them about the problem and someone came in about 20 minutes after I had made the call. After seeing the problem, I was moved to another room which was bigger. Room service menu could use some more variety but the food was all right. In other hotels and serviced apartments that I have stayed in, they make up your room daily. Not sure how it works in this hotel as when I came back Monday evening from my client meetings, the room was still in the same condition as I had left it in the morning. On Tuesday though, they made up the room. I liked the pillow menu and used the feather pillow. It was also good to see that this hotel has standard items in the room that you don't have in other hotels such as a bath robe and slippers. The newspaper also gets delivered to your room as an option. Having the shuttle service to the airport is quite handy so would use this the next time I stay in Holiday Inn. Lastly, I found it quite useful in staying here since the hotel is located very near the offices of my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, quiet and pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: ziggysmum
Reviews.Content: We were returning from overseas at night so decided to stay near the airport and continue on home by train the next day. Holiday Inn was very convenient and a pleasant place to stay. We got an excellent deal through Wotif.com and I think paid only $110 which was cheaper than Ibis and much better quality. Airport shuttle was easy, but we had to wait about half an hour, they run only every 40 minutes and cost $6 per person, payable to the hotel. After 9 weeks in Europe we were thrilled to have tea and coffee facilities and even a few biscuits provided! Room was much larger than we'd become used to, bathroom likewise, and everything very clean and comfortable. There was only one towel but when we rang Housekeeping they arrived in moments with two more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location / Nice Place in General”
Reviews.Author: Pharo68
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel near the airport, this is a pretty good choice. The price is decent, and the location next to the domestic and international airport is convenient. The workout facility is pretty simple and the no frills, no personality, airport hotel stereotype fits the bill. The rooms are fairly dated, as is the over all decor. The pub in the lobby is a pretty good place to have a cold beverage, and the metro/train stop is only 300 meters from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we thought”
Reviews.Author: bookworm720
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to catch our flight back to the States. The hotel room was nicer than we expected. It was clean and spacious with a flat screen TV. You can take a shuttle or taxi to the hotel and the rates are comparable--we did both. The hotel is not near any restaurants that are open for dinner but there is a restaurant and bar at the hotel. We had dinner at Amelia at the hotel and we liked it. Check in and check out were painless, and the staffs were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to be more vigilant”
Reviews.Author: moffnme
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. Looked for the Holiday Inn shuttle at Sydney Airport (last used it 3 months ago) -found out it is now gone and replaced by Super Shuttle at a cost of $6 - which requires a stop at the Sheraton en route. Checked in and was pleased to be upgraded to 10th floor room a/c Priority club membership but room key would not open allocated room. Hauled my luggage back down 10 floors to reception, waited 5 mins to be served, clerk said she had written the incorrect room number on the card. Sigh...She gave me the correct room number then said "sorry about the mix up". MIx up? No, it was an error, she wrote the wrong room number on the card! Next morning, paid overnight car parking at the check out desk as I was told the payment machine in the basement was not working well. Was advised to buzz intercom at car park exit. Buzzed away for 10 mins - no response. Moved car away from exit, caught lift back up to reception - more waiting to be served, more apologies, "it must not be working". Eventually allowed out of car park. Despite that, the room was great, huuuuuuge plasma screen, lots of pillows and all in all, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise - This is an Airport Hotel???”
Reviews.Author: bluemoongoddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before our flights to NZ and the Cook Islands for our honeymoon. My expectations were low, considering we were going to an airport hotel. However, I was delighted when we arrived and saw how elegant the foyer looked. Great service checking in and out. The room we had was large and extremely comfortable with everything you need. I was shocked at how quiet the room was considering there was such a busy road below us and planes going all the time. We didnt hear any outside noise. The restaurant at the hotel, Amelia's was fantastic, we were extremely happy. I will definitely stay here again when flying out of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Standard airport Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Martyn7770
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on way home from Darwin to London. Shuttle bus from airport takes 5 minutes. Lobby is clean and functional, with very friendly and helpful staff at the desk. Check in was efficient and rapid. I requested a slightly later check out to prevent having to spend extra few hours at the airport and, being a priority club member, this request was accomdated immediately. The room was nice enough, a good size and a comfortable bed with a nice bathroom. Nothing stunning, but clean, comfortable and functional. The breakfast buffet was somewhat overpriced, even the continental option, given that there are so many options to eat in the city. I had a few hours to kill the next morning so went into the city. The best option by far is the train. Mascot station is a very easy, safe 5 minute walk away, with a return ticket costing just under AUD10 which takes you right into the city centre, either Circular Quay, or central, or anywhere you need.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great TV”
Reviews.Author: Makaroni
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Wotif as a Mystery Hotel, and were delighted to find it was a Holiday Inn. We had a bit of a wait for our shuttle from the airport, but were able to check in at midday. The airconditioning was freezing, but we were able to turn it down to an acceptable level. Lovely room, with the biggest TV I have ever seen, if we didn't have an early flight next morning, we would have liked to watch a few movies. Very comfortable bed, didn't need to choose from the pillow menu, as they were fine. It was a short walk to Mascot train station, where we caught a train to Circular Quay, and a ferry to Manly. Our only complaint was when we had a snack in the bar, which being Friday night was very noisy and smoky, and I suspect patronised by locals. The tables were dirty, and when we mentioned it, were given a cloth to clean it. We had to fetch our own food and carry it to the table. There was no mention of a swimming pool in the room information. Although we were asked if we wanted a wake up call when we checked in, it didn't happen. Apparently some other guests didn't receive one, as the person responsible for it was away on the day. In spite of a few glitches, we enjoyed our stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel is Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ByronBay1
Reviews.Content: We arrived of an early flight and were greeted by a Holiday Inn Sydney Airport Van waiting at the front of Arrivals. Arrived at the Hotel at about 8.30 am and didnt expect our room to be ready but the friendly check in staff toom our bags and we headed of into the City for the Day. When we arrived back our bags were already in our room. The room was spotless. Quite large with plenty of air-con, lighting and tables. Also had a nice view over the Qantas Offices. We were on the fourth floor. Pool was indoor in the basement and very small but fuctional. Gym and Sauna were good too. All the staff were friendly and food in the restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay long but the breakfast was good.”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Holiday Inn Sydney airport on new years eve for 3 reasons. I like Holiday Inns (you know what to expect), we were flying out to the US the day after and most importantly, being new years you couldn't book any other hotel in Sydney for under 4 days!! Its location is fine, the transfer is fine, the room is fine. Its fine :o) Plus marks for the breakfast which was above average for a Holiday inn which is saying something. Minus marks for room noise and for cost! Its a very expensive HI and when we thought back, due to New years and catch our flight in the morning we spent very little time in the room but paid though the nose for it. You pay for airport transfers too! And internet! So I'd say it was above average as most HIs are but it is what it is, an airport hotel to lay your head and have an above average breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport stop over”
Reviews.Author: Midget_Gems
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn as a stop over on my way back to the UK. The hotel was clean, spacious, had a good bar etc so I was quite happy. Only downsides being the shuttle bus only goes every 30 minutes - when I arrived at the airport and waited for the bus for 20 minutes I rang the hotel to see when the next bus should arrive to be told that it had been 10 minutes ago. I consequently told them that I had been there for the last 20 minutes and nothing had turned up. They then offered to pay for a taxi to the hotel which they did. There is a small fee for the shuttle bus which was around 5 AUD....I think this is a bit cheeky personally but I wasn't fussed paying it.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and shabby.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelsQld
Reviews.Content: The price of a room here is as much as a decent hotel room in a nice part of the city. The king room booked and paid for was not available - was downgraded to two single beds but had to insist on a part-refund. The hotel is a dump - old, tired and shabby and does not warrant the many stars (nor $ value) attached to its name. Very expensive breakfast - cheaper to hold off and eat at the airport. The only consolation is it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't mind this one at all”
Reviews.Author: Ozstitcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before an early flight out. I originally booked a 1 queen/2 singles room on IHC's website but when we arrived, we'd been upgraded to a 1 King and sofabed room (there were three of us). The room was huge! A big L-shaped number that was situated around a storeroom type affair, so we only had 1 neighbour. Our room had a great view of the airport and we were able to amuse ourselves by watching planes land and take off. Inside the room was the aforementioned king & sofa beds plus a lounge chair, desk with 1 chair (not sure where the third person is supposed to sit if you get room service???), TV on a chest of drawers, minibar unit with fridge, wardrobe with robes and slippers inside. The bathroom was quite large and had an array of smelly stuff for the cleansing of one's body plus various other amenities like a razor, toothbrush and something called a 'vanity pack' which I actually read as a sanity pack! It consisited of some cotton balls & cotton buds. The water pressure & temperature of the shower was good - it was in the bath but there was a convenient grab-bar and the side of the bath wasn't very high thank goodness. We also scored a piece of fruit and a free bottle of water which was handy. There was internet access which we didn't use as I thought it would cost. Turns out, this room includes internet access. This is something that peeves me....there was nothing to say that. No notice to say if the internet is free, nothing to say how much it was if you had to pay either. Ergh. We had dinner in the restaurant, Amelia's. Here's another peeve. Apparently children eat free. But there was nothing on the children's menu to say this. None of the wait staff (& there were 4 floating around) told us either. It wasn't until we paid that we realised. No biggie, just another annoyance. We took the shuttle to the international airport. There are 2 different shuttles - one goes to the international & the other to the domestic terminals. There is nothing to differentiate between them so consequently, we had 3 people on our international shuttle who wanted the domestic & had to get off half way! Luckily we checked with the driver, before loading our bags. I would recommend asking them before jumping on. The shuttle cost us $12. I've noticed that other reviewers say it's $5 but that doesn't work out unless they charge children less?? Who would know, because once again, there's nothing anywhere that tells you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Airport Hotel Imaginable”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMc
Reviews.Content: Well, here's the litany of problems we encountered on our one night stay at this airport hotel. â€¢ Telephoned hotel from airport for shuttle, phone rang 15 times and disconnected. TWICE! â€¢ Went to room, connected to internet broadband system ($27.50/ day, highest charge I've ever seen or paid) and emailed spouse phone number of hotel to call. Rang 18 times, disconnected. â€¢ Television broken. Asked and received new room. â€¢ Computer downloading email from company server suddenly encounters very slow speeds on "broadband" system. Telephoned ISP, and told "you're downloading too much so we slow you down to modem speed". Nothing would change their mind, all for $27.50 a day! â€¢ Hotel refused to intervene, said they are "outside supplier". Rooms are OK, typical tired airport hotel rooms but clean and quiet. Business travelers with internet access needs should avoid at all cost . On my travels I have found these kinds of problems across Intercontinental-branded hotels in the region and I don't understand why this progressive company doesn't fix these problems in the south Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a one night layover”
Reviews.Author: travlin_canuck
Reviews.Content: I had a one night layover in Sydney and wanted something close to the airport after coming off of a 14 hour flight Some good and bad things i noticed and experienced at the hotel are listed below: Good Points - has free airport to hotel shuttle that runs at regular 30 minute intervals (but there is a problem going from the hotel to the airport...read on below) - great service, staff are friendly and helpful - no complaints at all - nice lobby, classy - bar and restaurant easily accessible - room was clean (i got the king bed room on ninth floor), modern furnishings, spacious bathroom, bed was comfy (lots of pillows), free high speed internet Bad Points - airport shuttle from hotel to the airport is billed at $5.00 - kinda funny considering the airport to the hotel shuttle is free - i thought that was cheap - smelly hallway (at least on the ninth floor) - as soon as you get off the elevator it hits you - a musty smell, made me wonder what kind of smell was waiting for me in my room (thank goodness my room didn't smell!) - carpets are well worn out in the hallway - it really stands out! the carpet is worn in front of all the doors - the food was ok - i would have said it was good but i had the unpleasant experience of the "hot" breakfast at the in-hotel restaurant "Amelias" - to be fair, there was a great spread of food, lots of fresh fruit with a wide variety, fresh baked pastries, lots of different juices - that part is good - but the "hot" breakfast was terrible - just thinking about it makes me wanna puke - the scrambled eggs were cold and watery, sausages were cold - there is no excuse for this, especially since i showed up at 5:30 am, when they open the restaurant, the food should be hot (or warm at least!) Verdict: I would stay there again for a layover only but icksnay on the "hot" breakfast

Reviews.Title: “1st Airport Hotel,but here goes”
Reviews.Author: 1moaningherbert
Reviews.Content: One night,pooped but happy.UK transfer,after 2 wks Pt Douglas 1:-Excellent Location (as name sugguests) if like us unseasoned travellers,you think "Oh my god,i hope we don't miss the flight". 2:-Short taxi ride to hotel(5mins).Hotel has mighty impressive foyer staffed by efficient and welcoming team. 3:-Room good sized en-suite,sound proofed to completely block local traffic,big double beds you don't want to get out of. LargeTV,hedadboard radio and light switches,tea making stuff. 4:-Storage for 2 heavy large cases and flight (pull-a-long)case,wardrobe 3/4 mirror. 5:-----3/4 bath and shower and all the smellies to lather yourself with,bit of a two step if 2 in bathroom at once but no great shakes once sat. We are not bean poles. 6:-Glitzy comfortable and relaxed hotel bar serving big fresh salads,huge olives,homemade pizzas,beer and cocktails.Menu caters for all tastes though.Smoking area in large heated conservatory. 7:-Breakfast help youself extencive buffet constantley replinished in large airey sunlite resturant,pricey Â£13 a head,but read this quickley,if you got in at 7/8 you could munch on to 10,definitley worth it if your hungry.We got in at 9:15 ,humph! You can go continental or as we did,everything.Didn't eat again 'til evening flight! 8:-Very helpful front desk on tube travel to the city,once back an easy transfer by hotel shuttle for lift off. 9:-What you spend at hotel you've saved in taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: EuroFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Sydney Airport is fairly conveniently located from Sydney Airport, although I would definitely not walk there with luggage. Upon arrival I realised that the room I was given did not smell very good - in fact it smelled pretty bad. So I called the reception and they promptly sent a porter up and gave me another room. The new room was perfectly fine. The size of the room was quite unremarkable - not too small, although not what I call spacious. There is a usable desk area and the bed was quite comfortable enough, and bathroom was functional. However, the decor was quite dated and the room was showing its age. I was not particularly expecting luxury or beautifully modern room so it was still quite OK. I was catching up with a friend in the lobby and wanted to get a cup of tea, but the breakfast area had closed. But they still let us sit there and order a pot of tea, which was rather kind of them. The staff were very friendly and it made up for the somewhat dated decor and the initial smelly room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smrlb66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Sydney Airport one night prior to returning to Canada. This hotel is very convenient to the airport. It's comfortable and has a first class, reasonably priced shuttle service to the international terminal. Highly recommended for anyone needing accommodation near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: User_Central_London
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay at the hotel as they had overbooked but I was not happy with how they resolved the problem...... I had phoned the day before and booked the room and at the time told them that I would be checking in late (my flight was arriving at the airport at 10:30pm). At the time of booking I also asked would it be possible to get something to eat and was informed that the restaurant would be closed but I could get room service. On arrival at the airport I phoned the hotel to check the arrival time of the free shuttle from the terminal to the hotel and they took my name and details. When the shuttle pulled up at the hotel the duty manager was waiting outside and basically pushed us into a taxi which he had waiting whilst he was explaining that they had overbooked and didn't have a room available but he had booked us into a 4 star in the city and would pay for our taxi there and back to the airport the next morning (as we had an early morning flight the following day). I wouldn't get into the taxi until I had spoken to him properly and he seemed very anxious to get rid of us as quickly as possible. I asked him details of where we were staying, did he know it, how far away it was and did they have room service (as per my booking the day before this was something I specifically wanted). I was assured it was a lovely place and yes they did do room service. On arrival at our new destination I discovered it was a block of serviced appartments with no restaurant, room service or even anywhere to get a drink of water. I also don't think it was 4 star as the room was in a poor condition and the bathroom was dirty. I called the duty manager to inform him that I was not happy but at this stage it was almost midnight so I just gave up and went to sleep, thirsty and hungry!! I have never been able to get a satisfactory answer as to why when I had only made the booking the day before they overbooked and why when they had both my email address and mobile telephone number they did not contact me when they realised the problem. I am also not happy that the duty manager either lied to me or did not know what he was talking about. Obviously I can't comment on the hotel itself as I didn't even set foot inside the door but be aware if soemthing goes wrong you might not be happy with how they deal with it!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Pat B
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel before it was renamed Holiday Inn - same hotel, same staff - different name is all. The difference was a doubling in their rates. This is NOT a $200 a night property. I used to be an airline pilot and used to stay at this hotel regularly - over 60 nights a year. It was ok - restaurant is very expensive but there is a little cafe next door which is reasonable where all the Qantas office workers go for their meals. Botany Road is a ten minute walk and there are many hole-in-the-wall restaurants there that are worth walking to. Out at the airport there is nothing to do, though - no nightlife or attractions of any kind, although this property offers convenience. It was great at arrive and get to this hotel after a long flight and crash into bed, so convenience is what they offer - but the rates are too high for the level of quality and they lose me there since it makes no sense to be paying this rate . The train station is a five minute walk and it's easy to go there and jump a train to the city center. Our rate was A$100 a night, and at that rate it was ok. Their present rates are just nuts! It's also getting worn - carpets are poor, bedspreads need cleaning. The place is either getting beaten to death or simply not being refurbished/maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a flight from Darwin in the early evening, checked in and needed to get to Olympic Stadium (now Telstra Stadium) straight away to see a rugby match. I debated about taking a taxi (would cost a fortune) and the desk staff went out of their way to explain how to find the train (the Mascot station is 2 minutes from the front door) and which trains to change to. Their instructions worked like a charm and it was a quick and easy way to get there and cheap. It's often the little things that leave a lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a smell”
Reviews.Author: Londoner29
Reviews.Content: Looked around for a comfortable hotel to stay for a night in Sydney before flying to Canberra the next day, some of the hotels around the airport are terrible so I thought I would protect myself by paying a bit more for some where clean and comfortable. I opted for the Holiday Inn based on reviews from tripadvisor. The shuttle bus took quite a while before it arrived, then we had to sit through the traffic in the domestic terminal before we reached the hotel. The whole journey including wait time took 1 hour 10mins, I would get a cab instead if you decide to stay here. Check in - quick and efficient Room - The reviewer in January must have got a more modern room than myself as my room looked old and stale and was crying out for a refirbushiment. Plus side was the room was very large. Bath room - Very simple and clincally, but once again like the room needed an update, the other major negative was that the sink and the toilet had an eggy smell coming out of it, which required the bathroom door to be shut otherwise you could smell it from your bed. Not nice! The staff are friendly and offer good advice, but for the price I paid was disappointed, maybe worth paying an extra few pounds and staying somewhere more modern.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: funkybunch44
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as my husband works in the area and we just wanted a night away from the kids. From the time I walked in there were problems. I booked a king size room and was told it would be on the top floor, but oh no it was on the first floor, when I complained I was told there were no other kingsize rooms available. Check in time was 2.00pm room was still not available at 3.10, I was then offered a free cup of cofee, which I declined. I was then given free overnight parking and a bottle of champagne but this did nothing to apese the bitter taste in my mouth. I am the type of person I like to get what I paid for not given freebies for poor service. Hotel could also do with a refurbishment. Reception staff were nice and polite in dealing with my problem but it should never have occured. Would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: CanOz11
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the room and amenities at this airport hotel. Great for a layover with shuttle service which can be booked the night before. Coming from the airport the shuttle seemed to take forever, but we could have just missed one. Comfortable beds ... the "pillow menu" was a nice touch. Provided a good nights sleep prior to an overseas flight. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flackillo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good airport hotel very nice rooms, clean and very friendly staff, they have shuttle to the airport and the hotel is just 1 block from the subway station, IÂ´ve overnigthed here for an early morning flight to US, so it is pretty much recomended, it is a little bit expensive, but it worth it, so if it is within your budget, this is a very very good option

Reviews.Title: “Ditto! Great Crash Pad”
Reviews.Author: Taisho
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with other reviewers. Great overnight place to stay when just passing through. NIce Hotel. Friendly and helpful Staff. They did everything for me except but put a shrimp on the barbie. The hotel isn't located near anything for the tourist except the AIrport. A train station is only 300M away. It cost us A$7.50 round trip each to Circular Quay. Pick up a schedule at the station. At the Airport there is a FREE dedicated Holiday Inn Sydney Airport Shuttle at Zone # 6. The Hotel is listed on the sign there. However, the shuttle will cost A$5 each person from the Hotel to the Domistic/International Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: davekv
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent â€œcrash padâ€� after our long flight across Australia with a need to overnight at the Sydney airport before traveling to the States the next day. What made it excellent was the staff. Everyone from the shuttle bus driver to the receptionist to the porter made us feel welcome. The room was more spacious than most Australian hotel rooms and it was clean, comfortable and quiet. All the amenities were there and everything worked perfectly. The room service food was excellent (great scrambled eggs!) and was delivered quickly and hot. A very good property that is recommendable if you need to stay near Sydney airport.

Reviews.Title: “good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbirchal
Reviews.Content: After a 24 hour flight from the UK, this hotel was great for an overnight stay/"catch up on your sleep" sort of place. Great blackout blinds, quiet. The family rooms were large and clean. Consierge service punctual. Breakfast was great too. Staff were polite and welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking Warning!”
Reviews.Author: forestgirl
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this is a lovely hotel but sadly despite booking a room weeks in advance of our stay (and providing credit card details for payment), we arrived very tired after an evening internal flight to find our room was not available. Be aware when booking a room here that this hotel operates a deliberate over-booking policy - confirmation of your reservation is no guarantee a room will be available to you. A room at another hotel 20 minutes away was arranged for us which was ok-ish but this experience was not really how we wanted to end our trip to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good Ariport Hotel (ideal location for Sydney Domestic Terminal)”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Winchester
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I want from an airport hotel. Good sound insulation between rooms, blackout curtains for day time sleeping, air conditioning that actually holds a temperature and is fairly quiet, and a shower that works well. Very convenient for the domestic terminal (two sets of lights on a straight road). Shuttle bus (per person charge) that I didn't use, but seemed well organized with a large closed trailer for the luggage and at least two mid size busses in use when I was there. Parking is under cover, you can self park or have a valet do it for you. You need to leave your keys with the concierge, so they can shuffle cars around to make maximum use of their space by double and triple parking. Once you've paid for parking you get a card that will let you escape the car park, or let the valet do the work. Breakfast buffet from 5:30 was too late for my early flight, so consider check in time before you take a package with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: One of the nicer Holiday Inns I've stayed at. Great location to the airport - the shuttle to the hotel is free - you have to pay a nominal price ($4) to get back to the airport which I thought was a bit cheaky. Paid $145 Aus for a very nice room. Nice staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in February after an overseas trip on our way home to Queensland. We arrived about 9pm, ordered a meal (which was great). The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Bed was great! After a long flight we just wanted a good night's sleep, which we got! Room service that nightwas good, we had it for breakfast and it was great! Lots of lotions and potions in the bathroom and i used the bath bomb to have the best bath i'd had since i'd left home! Friendly staff, very helpful and a cheap shuttle service back to the airport for our flight home the next day. Also a bottle of champage as it was our honeymoon - nice! For $144 AUD, money well spent, would definately stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Good for stopovers - not a holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: JelliB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between a 10 hour flight from the USA and flying home early the next morning to canberra. we had stayed here before for work and had our bill charged twice but this time, the service was great. We had booked via [-------] from Hawaii and on arrival were told only a smoking room was available. Once we turned the aircon on, it was fine. The bed was fabulous and the room spotless. I would recommed this hotel for it's close proximity to the airport (shuttles start from 5am and run on the 1/2 hr from then - AU$2 p/p) but it's not a place you would stay when coming to Sydney on a holdiay. They say it's a quick taxi ride/drive to the city, it's not. The train runs close by, but you don't want to be riding that after dark!

Reviews.Title: “From now on this will be my base in Sydney if time is an issue!”
Reviews.Author: Comfy-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I fully agree with the review stating that this is the best choice if you want to be close to the airport and you do not have much time. The nearby rail station of Mascot enables you to get to just about any Sydney location within half an hour. Great rooms, professional staff who are very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Short on time-stay here”
Reviews.Author: hiwayhowie
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to endure a long rail trip to the airport for a morning flight I opted to stay at the Holiday Inn, Sydney Airport. The location is convienient and an easy walk from the "Mascot" City Rail station. The hotel shuttle is a nominal AU $4.00. An easy, safe, walk to Mascot station & all of Sydney area is within easy reach. Usual "airport pricing" for food, however the drink prices were reasonable for the area. Don't plan on walking to any resturants as the area is mostly large commercial complexes. Take the rail as mentioned above. You can negotiate a rate on the weekends. Check your bill upon checkout as I found my billing was $10.00 above the rate quoted upon checkin. Probably an oversight as there was no problem in obtaining adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBeaches10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly staff. Rooms great, they have carried out a lot of refurbishment and offer great facilities. New gym is great.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Woes”
Reviews.Author: Vilavisitor
Reviews.Content: We have also stayed at the Holiday Inn on several occasions and each time have had problems with the hotel's restaurant. Bad service mostly, and on one occasion it was an hour before the meal was served! Not what you need when either coming off a long flight or preparing for one.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Sydney Airport
HotelInfo.Address: Bourke Road & O'Riordan Street | Mascot, Sydney, New South Wales 2020, Australia
